LTt9tZfJbBiv04jo3MtYUw.text: This place is small but full of flavors!  The broth are so good and flavorful. Meats are great. I hope they have more choice on the seatings instead of bars set up. For us with little kid in tow, it would be more comfortable to have a family meal on a table or booth. Definitely coming back especially colder days are around the corners.

-_6aaPa9lxzn5atVfq-TNQ.text: Our first time here and we were not disappointed. The food was amazing and the staff was friendly and helpful. We ordered the Yojie's cut and Kobe beef with sukiyaki broth. The broth was sweet and delicious and the beef was so tender. We weren't sure about dipping the beef in raw egg after you cook it in the broth but it was surprisingly good. It balanced out the sweetness from the broth. Afterwards you can put your veggies and noodles in the broth to make some soup. :) cant wait to come back.

This was my first time doing shabu shabu style and they taught me how to do everything. Very fun. Very delicious food. I ended up getting the Kobe meat. Soo good. I definitely recommend this place.

eVSXtcAt66UsPOVQb6A38w.text: Excellent customer service and food to match. THe owner is very involved and enthusiastic and very welcoming

4ge5jPHKhSkEBNCbbcCE-A.text: First time and it was so good!!! Thank you Val! Her service was on point &I always checked on us if we needed anything. A must try on the green tea white chocolate fondue!

bBT2ss2nUL4NUCgxNKhH-g.text: I went there with my husband , we both love it, the meats are very fresh, we ordered chicken , beef, pork belly with sweet shabu shabu, yummy !

UdJDcugtc9fsQd1Iibtu6g.text: The service is very good and informative, however this is the first shabu restaurant that I've been to that charges for the swish sauce!!!

qbCS0W7WcdWDrORiGqvQhQ.text: Second time here. Portions of meats are good and prices to add more is solid value. Went for lunch(favorable pricing) this time with my son. He had a Japanese soda( the one with the marble in the neck of the bottle ). We had the yojie cut angus and pork belly sukiyaki style. Presentation is on point with the color and marbling of the meats looking just as good as they taste. Definitely recommend sukiyaki style with the raw egg to dip your food in (adds richness).  For dessert we had ice cream. Server recommended a purple ube (yam ice cream). Actually pretty good. Vibrant purple color with interesting flavor. I'm sure we will be back slot especially when winter hits.

So0cW3o7HgtyyzxfMi9-9w.text: Excellent food & presentation. Service was superb and both waitresses and owner are very personable. Venue is sleek, clean, and modern.

ZogjXvGTPdML5_0fodoyDg.text: This place was awesome.  I have been looking for a good Shabu Shabu place and I think I found it.  I will definitely go back again when I visit.  The price was reasonable for the amount of food you get.  The ponzu sauce was yummy and the vegetables were perfect for the Shabu Shabu.  My friend and I were able to sit down and talk without being rushed out the door.  We didn't get to experience the desert fondue but it sure did look good.  Maybe next time.  The location was easy to get too and we felt safe.

keCNKXi-5rvo-pnuf2nevg.text: To start off, it's all bar seating so if you're coming in with a big party I would call ahead to make sure there's enough space. It's a diy cooking concept in a hot pot and self seasoning of sauces and broth so if you're lazy, don't come here. I had the spicy miso, yojie cut geisha size, brown rice, and chose goma and an egg as my dipping sauces. I usually get the egg when I have the sukiyaki broth but I decided to try it with the spicy miso since I love dipping into the raw egg. It is on the pricey side for shabu but this is like the only legit shabu place in Vegas so I'm willing to pay more for good shabu. I'm from Cali so I'm used to dinner shabu regular size being $20 or less. Overall, I would recommend this place and would come again. Meat tasted fresh, goma sauce was perfect consistency, they accommodated to my replacements on veggies I didn't like, servers were knowledgable, their green tea infuser is neat to use, and they had an ice cream flavor that tasted like taro! It's a must get.

W73vqdovbyWf1Xv8sySccA.text: My husband and I got addicted to Shabu Shabu and Sukiyaki while being stationed in Japan... And this place is the perfect spot to cure our withdrawals!! Not only is the food absolutely amazing but the staff is incredible as well. After meeting the bright, kind, and impressive co-owner Jo Koy we are fans for life. So glad it's in Vegas because this place is awesome in every way.

lunOaj2zJdp4dUVJ6WAADQ.text: As I considered this review I wanted to be as fair as possible, I went based on a comedian I follow who hyped up his restaurant and as an avid shabu shabu customer the first place I wanted to hit once I arrived to Las Vegas was this joint! Well let just say everything was subpar! My veggies were old and rotting, the meat I ordered (yojie's cut) looked old with brown spots and what was suppose to be upgraded meat (prime rib) that my wife ordered was more fat than meat! Our server spent more time talking with her friends who were right next to us the servicing us! She even commented on how expensive the Kobe beef and wagyu was at this place and they should try it some where else! I mean really! (We had actually considered ordering it to try it, thanks for sharing that!), don't get me wrong not everything was bad, the sukiyaki with the dripping egg  was awesome (never tried it b4), and the place looked amazing! Yet I always told myself I wouldn't write a negative review unless it was totally merited and this place unfortunately did deserve this review. Sorry yojie

wDNGQ6xCL46Kqpn6Hqxgjg.text: Fantastic experience! Our servers made our visit extremely enjoyable. The cuts are great, the attention to detail is great, the attitude is great, the atmosphere is great! Can definitely see a bright future for this branch! Count me addicted! Love how they make your leftovers into an udon soup for you to take home

RvHfdEp26WWGWnMrX-iwig.text: We got the Wagyu at ~$25 an ounce... ouch! But man was it good. Also got the pork. Overall I think it's a little pricey but still fun. We stopped about a week ago and they didn't have their liquor license yet but said they should in the next couple of weeks. We'll be back. The serving "bar" is really long so if you have more than 3-4 people you might be too spread out to talk to the person on the end

IMClDAyHk-kG5jxho8rF_w.text: Awesome food and excellent service! Very inviting and friendly atmosphere. Everything is fresh and the meat is of the highest quality. Highly recommend this place to everyone!

3UjXnApJXs4gmWHnqNX3rQ.text: So I finally got a chance to hit this place up and see what all the fuss was about. It was an easy choice for a late birthday celebration as it is right down the street from me and I heard alot of really good things about it. I have to say the service was great and vibe of the place is inviting, modern and fun. The wait staff was really friendly and informative on the choices and on how to get the most out of the experience there. They have plenty of choices although I felt a bit confused on how they compartmentalized the different combinations. I just went with the one that appealed to me the most which was the strait forward shabu shabu option. After going ahead and diving into to the hot pot style dinner, I thought the food was good and the process was pretty fun. At the end we tried the condensed broth after it reduced down with all of the flavors of the vegetables and it tasted a bit flat. Gladly our waitress saw us desperately dousing our dirty water broth with soy sauce and offered a bit of udon soup base that we gladly accepeted. After lacing the boiling water with some of the base it was a compellingly improved product. Overall, I enjoyed it for what it is and recommend it to anyone looking to try shabu shabu for a date night or celebration dinner. For the same price though, Shabu grill in henderson offers much more variety, and it's all you can eat. That being said, yojie is much more attractive of a setting and might be a better bet if you're trying to make an impression on someone special.

Nj0WZHBHky8rHKGbhM0ZKA.text: Amazing! The food and service is fantastic. The whole experience is worth it and Carl the server was very knowledgeable!

MsoDVBkhTD5gSmkPD5pqtg.text: Nice helpful staff.   Great prices for what you get.   No current liquor license.   Atmosphere was pretty good.

oefAeb9hxD0E3_JtqJBxbA.text: Awesome customer service. Staff is very friendly, accommodating, and bubbly. Our server, Carl, was nice enough to to give us a crash course on the "how to" with shabu shabu since it was our first time. Will definitely recommend this place to family and friends.

cHlwwB01rY5ajfV_oeRYJg.text: Omg I'm impressed. The wagyu was $14 an ounce and definitely worth it. It melts in your mouth and the sukiyaki broth with the raw egg was amazing. Vegetables were nice and crisp before letting them cook in the broth. Also it comes with rice, glass noodles, and udon. Definitely one of my new favorite spots.

photos.caption: Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yojie combo with pork and the wagyu

L1C8TCTIO50Z-W-vNLv9cg.text: RECOMMEND!!  I must be honest, this is one of the best hotpot restaurants I have been to in a while. I used to work at a hotpot restaurant, but Yojie in particular is very affordable and I love how it comes with a bowl of vegetables. Lots of vegetables. The lunch special ranges from about $11-20 which is a great deal! When I went the first time with my friend, the service was amazing. But I must say that the second time I went with my mom, the service was horrible. My waitress barely checked up on us, but when she did, she didn't ask if we needed anything else, or if we were okay. She just picked up some of our plates and went back to go talk to her friend that was sitting by the register. Although the service that time sucked, the food was delicious!! This may be my go to hotpot restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Geisha (5oz) Prime Rib-Eye! With a bowl of vegetables, goma sauce, and rice. YUUUUMMMM

wz10QQ39g8lPjDqtQjxb_g.text: Alright...it kind of pains me to have to write a 3 star review for yojies because I love the Socal locations.  I'm from Orange County and am currently in Vegas for a week so I decided to stop by for lunch.  I didn't want rice or noodles so they gave me a custom veggie bowl with mainly cabbage (or was it lettuce?) and broccoli.  As expected, I didn't receive any rice or noodles but also unfortunately didn't receive any extra broccoli either, just the usual 1-2 in each veggie bowl so I asked for some extra broccoli.  The meal was fine, just that the chicken I ordered was paper thin (what is this...chicken for ants?!).  -1 star  The server was friendly and chatted with me as I dined all by my lonesome.  The meal was fine and so I asked for the check... Remember that extra broccoli that I asked for? Well, I was charged 3.99 for them!    It's USUALLY NOT about the money but about the principle. In this case it was BOTH.   MONEY: $4 for some extra broccoli?  That's just criminal LOL  PRINCIPLE: If the server told me it was $4, I would not have gotten it.   At the end of the day, it comes down to, "Did I leave with a good feeling after the meal?  Did I enjoy the meal?".  It's either yes, no, or meh.  Honestly, I didn't feel good about the meal I just had.  When that's the case, I really want to give 1/5 stars, but I that's not a fair assessment.  You know that feeling you get when something doesn't feel right and you just have to say something? This was one of them.

fZR7BWApqmgbJPrxfDgJ4w.text: YOJIE IN LAS VEGAS!!! wishes do come True!  Anytime I went to Los Angeles I absolutely had to had to had to make a stop at this restaurant.  Before this restaurant I couldn't bare to eat at any shabu spot in the entire city of Las Vegas, they are all terrible.    This restaurant is quite a distance from my home but I am happy to make the drive to satisfy my shabu craving!  THIS RESTAURANT IS THE ABSOLUTE BEST!  so much so, that despite the wait for my food that I sometimes experience here they still receive five stars from me!  My typical  (little lady appetite) order: Yojies cut Geisha Half sukiyaki Half tonkotsu  How I eat it? Extra garlic and raddish in the sukiyaki Cook meat in sukiyaki Cook udon and veggies in tonkotsu   Even when I am full, I want to continue eating.  HEAVEN. I appreciate the individual burners. The tea pots that dispense from underneath are cool.   Still waiting for some alcoholic beverage options.

EJbspm9hv7NCqpPztAdyWA.text: Omg of my favorite places! Absolutely love the flavors and service! Valerie is amazing!! Very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu. We will be returning regularly!

photos.caption: Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zJzhZ3sy-Y1nTOAYnYlVdA.text: TL;DR: If you don't like Jo Koy's stand up, that's okay because I don't either and I like this place. Lol jk.   What can I say, this place makes my 'ting ting' happy. And by that I mean my stomach, you sick people you. Came here cause not only did I hear it was good, but also the fact I heard Jo Koy owns this place. When I'm not busy supporting him at thunder valley casino, I thought I should support him by visiting his restaurant.   Anyways, came in and this place was nicely kept. It was clean and the ambiance was modern. We came in pretty late, so we were seated quickly.   Food: We got the sukiyaki and the spicy miso broth. For meats we got the standard one (forgot what it's called) and the Kobe beef. With the sukiyaki you get a raw egg to dip the meat in after it's cooked, and don't look at me sideways my g, y'all know you eat dirtier things raw then an egg. I love sunny side up eggs so the raw egg doesn't bother me and it made the food that much better. The sukiyaki broth was good, it was salty and sweet. The only thing is since it's heated for a while the sugar burns and then when it's refilled it gets more concentrated cause they just add more of the same thing and it gets super sweet. Id ask for some water to put in there each time it's refilled. The spicy miso was pretty good, but nothing too out of the ordinary. The sauces that came with it were pretty standard too to what you'd get at other shabu shabu place, but none the less they were good. The meat was delicious and the servings were large and reasonably priced.   Service: The service was amazing. They were so personable and easy to talk to. If you're reading this Jo Koy the girl with the tattoos that's originally from SoCal did a good ass job with helping us so you better pay her more lol.   Anyways, I'm def going to come here more often whenever I'm in Vegas. If you're new to shabu shabu this is definitely the place to start.

txmEEj5kigOWD2w3nwG-1w.text: We arrived around 10:25 but didn't get in until 10:31 and they denied letting us eat.  Even though they close at 11:30 and they said their last call is at 10:30. c9LzNQIQDu1pv-vKfC9q7g.text: I've been here a couple times.  it is a pretty typical japanese shabu shabu place.  the meats seem to be decent quality and the pricing is ok.  i would say the sukiyaki is the best of the three i've tried, but im really not a fan of the upcharge for the better soups.  come here during lunch- you get the same thing for cheaper.

jiFL9bQcmoi_yFl7DHKJ8Q.text: Best Shabu Shabu ever. The meat just melts in your mouth. Nice atmosphere with modern decor. Always a wait. Nice, friendly staff.  The vegetable portion is a bit small compared to other Shabu restaurants I've been too. Dessert fondue is a great finish to any meal.

3A3sgrCOyEGsJfQRa2gahA.text: Going down a star after going today. Walked in and usually get served right away. Six people walked in after me and my party and everyone after us waited 40 minutes to eat. What happened? We were taking bets that they had to run to the supermarket to get more food or just didn't have any chopping finished. Either way I have never had to wait as long as we did today. I guess it's back to Swish for us. Too bad.

3Wh3x7utCwrDbqBHCDT4LA.text: This place is definitely my new addiction. The food is absolutely delicious. Staff is super friendly and helpful. I came here for the first time 2 weeks ago and have already been back again since. I got the Yojie cut with the Spicy Miso which came with your choice of 2 sauces. I picked the Ponzu and Goma. Both sauces went very well with my meat and veggies. For dessert, I highly recommend the white chocolate green tea fondue that comes with fruit and mini pastries. Loved everything about this place! You might just catch me here every week.

ZCWz1ytO3qnSOShsLi9UcA.text: Quality cuts of meat with old school jams playing in the background!  I always get the combo that comes with the Yojie cut (angus beef) and one other choice of meat (usually pork) and I always leave stuffed.  Every combo comes with a bowl of noodles/veggies for the hot pot as well.  The one thing, I don't really like is the extra up charge for the broths.  The one that doesn't come with a charge seems like just hot water...so I've never even tried it.  Our favorites are the sukiyaki with the pasteurized egg.  Pull the meat out of the pot, dip in the egg, and pair it with a little rice...perfect bite!  Rice refills are free here for the rice lovers out there!  The spicy miso broth is a second favorite.  FYI, you can do split pots and have spicy miso and sukiyaki, best of both worlds!  Our favorite drink here is the bottomless green tea arnold palmer.   One of the only cons, not the best place for a large group, since it's counter seating in a circle.

Yviq6ZvgHmz0EnuJRZQhxQ.text: Love this place! Great service, great atmosphere, decent prices (recommend going during lunch hours) and amazing food!! I hope Mr. Koy opens up another location closer to the southwest end of town, I'd be there every week :)

2qYF9Ef36ZB_JLWFZa4TAA.text: Honestly one of my favorite restaurants in all of Vegas, just in a terrible location hence why they're always seem to be so slow... just hope it doesn't go away one of these days

ohD4tVge14_-lCWCkijYdw.text: I am a big fan of Jokoy and when my cousin told me about his spot in Vegas we were all over it!  Unfortunately, we went the night before Memorial Day, 30 min to close and it was a 45 min wait.  They had a DJ out front but we decided to go somewhere else.  ...bummer.  Lucky for me, I went the next day for lunch and it was great!  No wait, a little cheaper for lunch and the waitress, Ozzy, was tons helpful!    Needless to say the food was great! abYmX_7AFGL1TC3ZOMmiyw.text: "Yo gee yay" Not "yo jee" like I was previously pronouncing it.   This is better than the traditional Japanese Shabu Shabu because... Flavor.  Don't get me wrong, I get that you have to tweak the broth and dips to flavor up the meats and soup, but I like that Yojie offers an upgraded and more intense flavored broth with their Tonkotsu option. Their Tonkotsu broth is richer and has a nice fuller flavor than the other broth options.  Besides the broth, I really enjoyed their signature beef option. It was tender but also added more depth to the broth. The vegetables that come with are plentiful, and service is attentive. If you like spicy, ask for their hot stuff - you only need a dab to turn on the heat.   I look forward to their expansion and hope they come to the Southwest!

yYTA7QOyc1W4CJL0MaXKRw.text: We find ourselves in this part of town quite a bit, (I used to work at a place further down West Sahara, and one of the dispensaries I go to is on the same street), and though we'd been to several stores and restaurants in the area, Yojie is one we'd never been to.  And I was SO glad we went!  Although I had heard the term "shabu-shabu" before, (not to be confused with the excellent INXS album "Shabooh Shoobah",) I had no idea what it was, and being in the mood for something 'different', we ventured in.  Nice, clean place with a great design, and counters on either side of the restaurant.  If I recall correctly, the name of the wait person who helped us was Amanda, (and I only remember because one of my good friends from Dallas is also named Amanda), and she was great to talk to, as well as more than a little helpful in assisting us with navigating the intricacies of "shabu shabu" cooking and dining. Up until this point, fondue to me was a chafing dish filled with melty cheese or chocolate mixtures, that you dipped various things into.  Same principal here, except now it's savory and sometimes sweet hot sauces and broths that you douse paper-thin sliced meats and assorted veggies into.   We found the whole process strange, but fun. Bear had a little trouble with the chopsticks at first, but they don't leave you hanging if you can't seem to "get it."  It's been a while since our first visit, and with my birthday coming up, I'm thinking, "Why not?"  Highly recommended for both the adventurous and the health-conscious foodies.

1-0RCHH1DDEV9KUmKSjuPw.text: I was impressed.   The meat was cut super thin and the Yojie cut was perfect.   As I dipped my raw meat into the broth and then rubbed it in a raw egg mixture, my instinct was to run away and avoid some illness, but the egg gave the meat a wonderful sweet flavor.   We were so stuffed that we had to return another day to try the dessert fondue.  Which we recently did. It was great too.  Loved the bananas with the green tea white chocolate.  The Japanese ice coffee was wonderful too.  This please is great.  Food, atmosphere and service all a big plus.

nNMnWyhozlFnHzFnxVqyXg.text: This had to be one of the coolest dining experiences I've had in a while. My husband, children, and I arrived for my nieces art viewing on January 7th. Her paintings are hanging on the wall at the restaurant and are absolutely beautiful. The owner of the restaurants name in is Anton. He was very nice and made sure everyone was comfortable while waiting for a table. 2 for 1 Sapporo. My husband and I shared the Samurai sizes Prime Rib Plate with Sukiyaki dip and vegetables, noodles, and white rice. The boys shared a Combo Plate with Chicken and Angus Beef and Tonkotsu dip. The girls shared a Combo Plate with Chicken and Angus Beef and Spicy Miso dip. I tried all of them with the different dips and my mouth was watering. The food was absolutely delicious. With barely any room left for dessert we still had to order one. We shared Milk Chocolate Fondue with strawberries and bananas. We will definitely be dining here again. Thanks for the great customer service Anton and staff!

wq5-bZpAbCIT5lS8keDHnA.text: Really great food and experience.  I would definitely skip the salmon next time and just order more and more of that kobe.  It was my first time restaurant this style and it was a really great time.  It's pretty limited on the seating so try and get there before the dinner rush.

-XEcax04KCo_8LZmdOglAA.text: Based on the reviews, I was really excited to check this place out. But I was disappointed. First, they've been open for a year and still don't have their liquor license?! WTF? The food was kind of bland (to me). The sauces didn't help much. Fondue is interesting and different, but I guess I would have just rather have my food cooked for me. I asked for extra veggies. The veggies I got were 1 floret of broccoli, 2 small strips of carrots, 1 little portebello mushroom, a bit of shiitake mushrooms, and some lettuce. It was pretty bland and not appetizing. They could benefit from having more veggies and some ginger (who doesn't have ginger at a Japanese place?!). The atmosphere and look of the place is cool though!

-vm4kS53RfyTEGrm1NpFQw.text: Had a fab time! Great service and light meal yet really satisfying! I look forward to going again.

587yjQVikjrY4hLnIEQnPg.text: Been wanting to try this place for a while and finally made some time to come here for dinner with a friend. We were greeted as soon as we entered and immediately got seated.   You have a choice between sitting at the low bar and the high bar and we decided to go with the low bar. Beware, the chairs make a loud screeching sound if dragged on the floor. There's also a few televisions to watch while eating.   The decor is simple yet very unique. There are various pieces of art on the north wall done on usps boxes.   I decided to get the yojie cut, shabu shabu pot with ponzu and swisher dipping sauces, and brown rice. This also comes with a little bowl of vegetables and noodles, which was pretty much 2 slices of carrot, some onion, udon noodles, thin glass noodles, one piece of broccoli, one large mushroom cap, two cubes of tofu, and some lettuce. I would've preferred some more veggies and meat.   For drinks, I got the tiramisu blend hot tea. It has a very unique savory taste to it, which I enjoyed. The refill came in this contraption where you place on top of your cup and it'll pour out of the bottom.   Service was great, the server explained everything clearly, mixed garlic and green onion into our dipping sauces, and we were often checked on to see if everything was ok.

lsdKrO1QlmfEJpg9jcYDhw.text: Came here because I love Orange Chicken, instead it's a Shabu Shabu place (google it!). For a second I thought it must be the JollyBee place next door! OK, enough of those! Of course everyone is here hoping to meet Jo Koy, no tourist drives half way across Vegas for boiled broccoli! And honestly I would have put up with any food or place for a chance to take another pic with Jooo-sep! But as soon as you get in you switch to a different gear, it's an upscale, take it seriously place and you wonder if you're in the wrong restaurant (again, you think it must be that Jollybee!). Great setup, upscale, great service, no nonsense, "we are not joking about this" kind of place. You get all the info you need to order, I got the Sumo kobe and my wife got the Geisha Yojie cut and the quality of meats and ingredients is top notch. Including the hot Tiramisu tea, absolutely try that. They took care of every detail and everything is put together just to make sure it's done right. Definitely a place to put on your list when in Vegas, you got this one right Jo but don't quit your day job!

_QTe6W5K-utDC4jcFHZFog.text: This place is great ! Some of the best Japanese food I've had in a while . Defiantly gonna be back and not just for the food but their service ! Azaleiha and Vhalery were the ones who took care of my friends and I . Keep up the good work and thanks again ladies !

dmaDVaNilItZ9Z8PjvE7Eg.text: Could you open a Yojie in Austin, TX? I'm going to miss you so much! I wasn't sure what to expect for my first shabu shabu experience but I was impressed, and full by the time I left.   We walked in just a few minutes after Yojie had opened for the day. There were already two parties waiting when we sat down, and another party came in and sat at the high bar as well. The two waiters had a little bit of trouble keeping up with all of the parties, as we all ordered at once, but the atmosphere was fairly casual so it just felt paced. We watched the Japanese TV shows they had playing that were interesting, and enjoyed the space in general. They were more than happy to explain options and describe choices and let us take a little bit of time choosing. Meanwhile, they took our drink orders - a green tea and an Arnold Palmer-san, both of which were really good.   We ended up choosing the following:   One Combo plate, (included Kobe beef) with Kurobuta pork and Tonkatsu, (the pork broth), and one Geisha sized Kurobuta pork and Tonkatsu. We asked a bunch of questions about the Tonkatsu, as it wasn't clear on the menu whether it was made with milk or not. It's not - when they say creamy on the menu, it is because it looks creamy and has a creamy texture because of the pork, but no milk is used. They set out our bowls and got our broths going on the induction stoves in their bowls while we waited. The thin sliced meat came out on square plates, and the veggies came out in a slanted bowl - all gorgeously arranged, and with generous portions. The veggies included: a big mushroom, lots of tiny white mushrooms, a lettuce leaf, rice noodles, other wider noodles, a ginger slice, cubes of tofu, carrots, broccoli, and onions. We also received a bowl of rice. By then our broths were ready. Before we started, our waiter came over with tongs and ladles and asked if we had any questions. We started loading our broths with veggies and meats, watching them simmer and stirring. We both decided to let our veggies stew for a while, and we started on our meats.   This slow process took quite a while... putting in more veggies, letting them simmer, having a little meat, ladling out a little broth for our veggies...stirring the broth. At some point, somehow we had eaten all of the things and we were just down to the broth. The waiter came by and turned off our stoves so that the broth could cool. This was honestly my favorite part, as the thickened broth at the end was amazing. We sat and slowly sipped our broths for a while and finished them, it was so good. We absolutely loved it.  I'd also like to mention their bathrooms - they don't seem like much when you go in there - lots of grey concrete, and they're pretty cold. The sink, however, is a wide waterfall that you turn on that is SO COOL. Check it out!  For what we ordered, we paid about $65 including tip. While it was a bit expensive, it was still really worth it for the experience and the portion sizes. Like I said in the beginning of my review, I'd really love to see Yojie open a location in Austin. When we got back home, we looked for shabu shabu places and there's only ONE here. Food for thought, Yojie! ;) Thank you for being fantastic.

dy4MToQ5EzHCwE70w366GQ.text: I came here twice for dinner and thoroughly enjoyed the place. It's a tiny place with modern decor. The first time I came here, the TVs were showing horse racing and the second time was showing another sport. The music choice here is a bit odd as they play a mixture of 90s and 2000s music and it doesn't feel like it fits/matches the aura of the place.  The first time I came here, I ordered the spicy miso broth and the vegetable medley (I asked for the mushrooms replaced with something else) with ponzu and goma sauces and a side of brown rice. I also ordered the cherry blossom tea because it was something very new and unique-sounding so I had to try it. The cherry blossom tea tasted like green tea. I was confused, thinking maybe they gave me plain green tea but as I drank more, I could taste a hint of something else. However, whatever it was, became overpowered by a green tea flavor.  Melanie (I think that's her name) was our server and she was awesome. She was always smiling and happy, always checking in making sure everything was okay, if we needed anything else, and overall gave really good customer service.   The second time I came, I ordered the exact same thing (I don't have other options as a vegetarian) but with Japanese iced coffee instead of cherry blossom green tea. The Japanese iced coffee tasted like plain iced coffee but with what tasted like brown sugar? It's a subtly sweet flavor, not what I expected, but I didn't hate it either and I'd order it again.   This time, Azi was our server. She wasn't friendly and had a bit of an attitude. She didn't care to ask us about our meal or check in on us. She would walk by without saying anything but would check in with other guests. Very different from Melanie's customer service. However, this one server, a guy named Shannon, started to check in on us and he was extremely kind and more than willing to help us if we needed anything. He checked in on us a number of times, always asked if we needed more broth or wanted more water, he was superb. He even offered to take our pots to the back and put them in to-go containers and wrap them up for us! I was shocked at his willingness to do such a thing for us, and I was so happy to see that level of customer service. He even marked one of the containers so I'd know which one was mine.   For my food, I was skeptical to try a miso broth because I grew up eating miso soup a lot (I come from an Asian family) and couldn't imagine eating it as a spicy hot pot broth. I was, however, pleasantly surprised at the flavor and enjoyed every bite of it. I was also very happy with the portions given for the vegetable medley because, as a vegetarian, that was all I could eat there and it filled me up nicely.  We were only allowed to pick two of the three different sauces which saddens me because in Hawaii, we're used to having 10 - 20 different sauce options that we can pick from freely and even mix and match sauces to create our own unique sauces.   For dessert, we ordered the milk chocolate fondue with "berries and bananas" (strawberries and bananas). I had some expectations of the fondue since it's in the name of the restaurant but there wasn't anything special or unique about it. Yojie might benefit from doing something unique or special to their fondue because, in reality, it is plain fondue (it is, after all, called Yojie Japanese Fondue, so do something unique with it).   I hope management acknowledges the customer service skills of Shannon and Melanie because they were so attentive to us. Melanie even remembered us the second time we came back! I will continue to come back here again but I'd hope to not get Azi as our server again.

-12qNzK2Jf7YSo8s9yHYKQ.text: I've had Japanese hot pot maybe four times, two of which were at Yojie. So far, I've tried the tonkotsu and sukiyaki broths with Yojie's cut (beef) and chicken. I prefer the tonkotsu over sukiyaki as the sukiyaki broth was a bit too sweet for me. Though, I did enjoy the pasteurized egg to dip the meats in when I had the sukiyaki broth. It was a good combination and added a buttery flavor to the meat after being cooked in the sweet broth. My husband chose the spicy miso broth both times and it is great for all the spice lovers. It's not overly spicy, but if you want an extra kick, ask for the ghost pepper sauce. Seriously, you only need maybe two drops of it and it can be added to any broth.   The cuts of meat are a good portion because you're also given a bowl of assorted vegetables and udon plus a cup of rice. The first time I had Yojie's cut with chicken and it was a lot for me that I had leftovers. The second time, I chose Yojie's cut, geisha size (5 oz) and it was the perfect amount of meat for me. You also have a choice of two dipping sauces. I chose the goma and ponzu sauce. The ponzu sauce had a better flavor in my opinion.   On the second trip, hubs ordered the green tea white chocolate fondue with strawberries and bananas. I tried a bite and the blend of green tea with white chocolate was surprisingly amazing. Even if you aren't a green tea fan, it's definitely worth a try.   This place is also good for those on a low carb diet as I currently am. I skipped the rice and had just a bit of udon, but mostly the veggies with the meat and was full enough.  I can't wait to return and try other meats with the broths, maybe the pork belly, also their teas and other desserts when I'm not limiting my caffeine and carbs.

d7TGC3GUvDEg-8vYq0gylg.text: I'm a huge fan of Jo Koy so I was excited to try this place out. Apparently he tends to pop in and out so maybe you can get lucky and catch him in here.   The set up in here is great and everything looks clean and well organized. Take some time to admire the awesome pics along the wall.   The menu is nice and simple which is typically a good sign for any place. You basically pick your type and quantity of meat and then the broth you'll be dipping in. I chose the Yojie Cut beef and the spicy miso broth. The meat is accompanied by a bunch of veggies and noodles as well as a bowl of rice. The spicy miso itself is a great soup and just the right amount of spiciness. As for the beef, its thinly sliced high quality meat that cooks in mere seconds when dropped into the delicious broth. Everything goes great together for a great light yet filling meal. I recommend the ponzu and swisher sauce.   The specialized tea infusers are pretty neat, and the tea is high quality. For dessert, don't miss out on the Ube (Taro) ice cream! I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu.   P.S. For a bit of a bargain, I'd recommend coming here during lunchtime, its a little cheaper for the same amount of meat.

i_kHzKwMvEUgvRGcS1PcTg.text: Pretty disappointed in this place which ive been dying to try. Dont get me wrong, the meat is delicious just a little lackluster. A whole plate looks like a lot but when you cook it each slice becomes a small bite so if you do come here get the largest size if youre super hungry. Dont get the $2 egg, doesn't add anything to the flavor. Would have given 4 stars, but dessert was horrible. $8 for average chocolate and "pastries and fruit" which ended up being super small slices of banana and strawberry and frozen pound cake. Server kept asking us personal questions while we were just trying just to eat. Also the stoves are a bit far from the edge of the table and you had to stand up to mix.

p8tN2-45osUOeKxMtIF4Og.text: When I read that this restaurant was affiliated with Jo Koy, I was excited to try this place. I'm a huge fan of Jo Koy.  However, I was disappointed in the sauce. We ordered the sukiyaki and the broth was overwhelmingly sweet. I understand everyone has a different flavor palette and for my boyfriend and I, we just couldn't tolerate the broth. I diluted it many times with water and I still couldn't pass the sweetness. If you like a broth that's very sweet then the sukiyaki is the way to go. The portions are definitely decent. The ambiance was interesting. The music was a bit loud and I felt like I was at a nightclub even though it was daylight but I think that ambiance would be good for anyone wanting a quick bite to eat before heading out to paint the town red.

2WB8iL08wgXiZJmtkxiFPQ.text: Great place , good service . I love there traditional Shabu Shabu restaurant with all the seating being in a U shape . We order the pork belly ,yojie cut . And Kobe beef with spicy miso soup add $2 more . The miso soup is so delicious . I love it . Will come back !!!

gnoU7N8OloPpwGdozhs5Tg.text: Great food and flavor!!! The service is the worst,  can't get a water glass refilled or tongs to cook with because nobody did the dishes. Tables and menus are dirty,  It's a shame I liked this place (atmosphere and food).   We gave it another chance last night and I am happy to say the service is 100x better.  Thank you for your improvement!!!   The owner even stop by and introduce himself then ask if everything was good.   Nicely done

XLp9eyJEgGTAjEjTb-kJpg.text: Do not go here if you are not prepared to start obsessing about the different soup bases and combinations. They only offer a few selections and choices, and each is essentially perfect. The Tonkatsu Base in my opinion is heaven in a bowl. Combined with the fresh veggies, and amazing salmon, pork belly, Kobe Beef, or Wagyu Beef (your choice) produce a meal in which you will remember for time to come. It is the type of place that ruins your old standby spot to Shabu Shabu, no more Yoji has taken it to the next level.  Combined with the amazing staff and those beautiful smiles you can't go here just once. You immediately start to wonder if you ordered the correct combination of sauces and meats, or could added too little or too much sesame. Can you achieve the perfect soup base to which your life will change forever? These are epic goals that you get to experiment with in this amazing little spot.   Only downside? It is cold in there this time of year. You will start to wonder if you are exhibiting the symptoms of hypothermia, and then in just the nick of time, one of the beautiful Geishas of Yoji, drop off a cart of magical food and turn on the lifesaving tiny heat source. The burner will eventually boil your soup base, producing a steaming caldron that lets you know, you are going to make it. Then you start the process of filling your slightly frozen body with the heavenly bliss of hot soup and the experience is divine.   Highly recommend this place and in fact, I want to go there right now.

8a4OVMHTGsPrv1tPejkVkg.text: This an awesome place. The employees here are all very nice and attentative. They also explain how the whole process works if your a newbie. Will definitely be back!

I413H_2WeVwNWyg165Ix9w.text: I honestly can't say enough positive things about the experience my girlfriend and I had tonight. I arrived in Vegas at 9 PM after a long five hour drive from Phoenix, and after checking into my hotel I hit up Yelp for a recommendation for late night dining. I'd never had Japanese fondue before, but after looking at the menu and reading the stellar reviews, my girlfriend and I headed out.   We arrived at a beautiful little restaurant in a quiet shopping center (though it's probably busier before 10 PM) and upon walking in were greeted by a cheerful hostess, fun, modern decor, and a sparkling clean dining area. Unexpectedly, the owners, phenomenal stand-up comedian Jo Koy and his business partner Anton Guerrero, were there, and after a mildly embarrassing star-struck handshake, Jo graciously offered to order for my girlfriend and I.   I wound up with the samurai portion of kobe beef with  shabu shabu and sukiyaki. Everything was delicious, but the kobe beef cooked in the sukiyaki and then dipped in the pasteurized egg is particularly incredible. My girlfriend had the steak and salmon combo with sukiyaki and miso (both of which were tasty as well) and Jo bought us dessert, the green tea and white chocolate fondue. Even with a couple of premium items on the tab (and a delicious coconut sake), we walked out for less than $100 including tax and a 20% tip. It should be noted, however, that you could easily walk away satisfied for half that price with more basic options (though the kobe beef was worth every penny).  The food alone was worthy of five stars, but the service and attention to detail were stellar as well. The wait staff were attentive and helpful as they taught us newcomers how to prepare our food and offered much appreciated tips along the way. Jo and Anton also went out of their way to make us feel welcome and provided a lively, engaging atmosphere fueled by Jo's inherent wit along with some surprisingly earnest and introspective conversation. They showed a genuine interest in our story and made us feel immediately welcomed and at ease.   We talked, we laughed, we ate, and ultimately my girlfriend and I walked away with a five star dining experience that we will never forget. Thank you so much to Jo, Anton, and the rest of the staff at Yojie for a wonderful evening. I couldn't recommend it more.

NVpFVCbchxFYX9a6bWBvxg.text: At first we decided to eat here only because my company and I were taking our chances to maybe see the famous comedian, Jo Koy. We did NOT see Jo Koy but definitely coming back for more of their food. Service was great. Everyone were cheerful and very helpful. Their art wall were all from a local artist, J Muniz which is all cartoon- like character that's wearing a rabbit suit. And the food....mmm! The food!I had the prime rib with the seaweed soup but surely will try a different kind of soup. The beef is tender and the vegetables were all fresh and not frozen. It was an excellent experience. It just hit the right spot. I'm sure to come back here for the food now and if I get to see Jo Koy, he will be just a plus to my visit! lol

f3MjVAtf_-0SjAgyQ1U-lg.text: Unfortunately, my experience with the actual food was nonexistent as signing in had no positive influence on the hostess' communication efforts. Myself plus three came in and signed in at 7:11 p.m. I briefly spoke with the individual and asked if we will be called. He said, "Yes, we will call you." We went to the coffee shop next door and around 8:00 p.m., we went back in to notice every other party that came in after us have been seated.  We asked the hostess to be seated ASAP as we saw seats were open. I'm pretty sure she should be spoken to by management as her behavior was unacceptable. She said, "I am going to seat these people first who came in after you first." I said, "Do you see any logic or sense in doing that as we were skipped twice already without being contacted? The gentleman said he would call us when we are up." She responded with, "No it doesn't and I understand, but I told these people I am seating them first even though you came in an hour ago." I was so dumbfounded... What a disaster!

Rny51HxeOIZIKTzsErvkBA.text: Came in with a group of 4 all first timers.  Signed in and saw many empty seats so the ladies proceeded to sit down.  A rude employee came over and started telling us that it's not appropriate to seat ourselves.  This place has no host,  is quite small,  and no waiting area.  I saw the sign-in book and signed us in but the others may naturally walked to all the open seats.  The place only had a few people.   It was all very odd and made everyone quite uncomfortable to be lectured life that after just walking in to a new restaurant. . We just turned and left.    Just because you have good reviews doesn't give you the right to belittle your potential customers.

p6bUM5phlHhcRacfWbvusg.text: Me and my girlfriend had come in for a late dinner around 9. We've had yojie before but this time i had to give a review because everything was on point! Our server attended to us right away and gave us a minute to look over the menu (Mind that we haven't been here for a year or so). They recently got their alcohol license, but from what our server said they're only serving beer at the moment until they take their class to serve sake. Upon ordering my girlfriend got the yojie cut in the smallest portion. I got myself the combo plate which consisted of the yojie cut and your choice of Chicken, salmon, pork, and pork belly. I chose the pork belly. Their offered vegetables such as broccoli, lettuce, half of a white mushroom, shitake mushrooms, carrots, onions, while also offering tofu, seaweed, udon and glass noodles. After they offer either white or brown rice. Then you choose your pot. They offer the original shabu-shabu broth that has a very light miso flavor, the sukiyaki broth, spicy miso, and pork broth. Me and my girlfriend both got the sukiyaki! With the sukiyaki they offer a pasteurized egg as a dipping sauce. It goes REALLY well with the broth and meat. I always pace myself because I eat a lot of rice with my whole meal.   After our dinner we got the green tea white chocolate fondue desert plate with fruits and strawberries. My girlfriends FAVORITE.  Yojie never disappoints. That is all.

Qwe-mVBG3r97GZiRTY1X5g.text: Love this place! I've been here several times with my partner and they have never let us down. I suggest the Kobe beef Shabu shabu style. It comes with lots of veggies, rice and some amazing dipping sauces. Sometimes they have the hilarious tv show MXC playing. Very happy they have their liquor license now

n0epD3xqCM5NHv0kIEqnGg.text: I ordered the Geisha salmon sashimi. I had 2 dipping sauces that the waitress recommended. Everything was fresh and tasty. My husband ordered the Samurai Kobe beef. That was amazing and he didn't really like the idea of dipping the meat in the raw egg, but I tried it and it was good. Service was really good and I didn't realize at the time that you can order a combination Geisha size and get another Geisha meat item for just $6 more! Will definitely order that next time and will have to try the white choc green tea fondue dessert.

k-fZKPseQL8scoTpVR3Zvg.text: Have been wanting to try Yojie's for about 8 months.  Had a couple hours to kill while visiting Vegas today.  Nice atmosphere and great service.  My husband got the chicken sukiyaki and I got the salmon spicy miso.  He definitely scored the best meal!  I will be getting the sukiyaki next time.  My salmon was delicious but the spicy miso was only so-so and not very spicy.  It was a new experience, worth an occasional visit.  We also had the green tea white chocolate dessert with fruit and pastries which was amazing...might have to go back for just dessert!

LmxUNrUV9ayu5ewAG09_3w.text: Hands down the best place to eat in Vegas! Worth the price and the service they offer here is honestly the best I've ever had. Their workers are diligent and friendly! From the amazing artwork to the delicious cuisine the offer, it keeps you wanting to come everyday! Cute workers as well and charismatic people here! Definitely would recommend this place to anyone who is a foodie or enjoys anything aesthetically pleasing! Yojie Japanese Fondue deserves higher than 5 stars

h-2VRrMiQmP5AGT-889bug.text: This place is so much fun. The staff are all extremely great. So helpful and have great personalities.  The quality of the meat is unrivaled. I have had the Kobe, salmon, and Berkshire pork and they are tasty enough to eat raw on their own.  I opt for spicy miso broth, but the others are just as tasty. Don't skip dessert! Green tea white chocolate is like a delicious soft caramel. Love this place. Worth the drive from the strip.  Tip: take an uber. It was $16 vs $43 in a cab.

jFZXC-lGq4Y3lC7j5EHlTg.text: Been meaning to write up a review for this joint.  Being a fan of Adam Carolla, I was turned onto the comedy stylings of Jo Koy through the ACS podcast.  Jo is a super funny dude and apparently knows how to launch and run a top notch restaurant as well.  The food was fantastic and Jo was actually in the house when we were there.  Really solid dude.  Took a pic with my family and ran out to his car to bring me a free DVD of his comedy.  Thankful to him and his wonderful restaurant and staff.  We'll definitely be back and I will continue to follow Jo's career.

xEGkitGtY4yC00FL6TQoQg.text: I went there with hesitations. What?! Cook my own meat at the table?   Took my family of 5 there and it was a blast... The staff brought out these pots of broth that were sinfully delicious. High quality thin slices of meat, you dip them in a pot, and boom!!! A flavorful explosion in your mouth. We could not stop eating. I loved it, the kids loved it... Pretty tough to do these days.  Was a little on the pricey side but definitely high quality and well worth it. We ordered the Samurai for my son and I. We had extra ponzu sauce and rice. Ended the meal with the fruit and pastry fondue. Order the green tea white chocolate sauce.

kLHr6Zvfp8rE9gJHkiYvQg.text: We kept hearing about Yojie Shabu Shabu on the Koy Pond (Jo Koy) podcast as well as the Adam Carolla podcast (both great podcasts), and we decided the next time we were in Las Vegas we would give it a try. The restaurant is not on the strip but it is close enough by car. We went around 1pm to make sure we would miss the lunch crowd but be aware they close at 230pm Monday thru Thursday and reopen for dinner at 5pm. We were seated right away and our server Mareianne took great care of since it was our first time. Each member in our party had their own "cooking" station. The variety of options was perfect. They have beef which includes the Yojie special, Kobe and even wagyu beef. They also have salmon and a veggie option. The salmon is so fresh it can be eaten sashimi style or lightly cooked. Everyone gets a choice of broth for cooking.  And the portion of veggies, noodles and protein is perfect.   I highly recommend Yojie. The beef was tender and the salmon was fresh. We were totally full but had to have the dark chocolate fondue for dessert. Which was a very good decision. It was the perfect ending to a perfect meal. Mr. Koy, you have a great restaurant in Las Vegas and whenever we are in Las Vegas you can bet we will go back to Yojie!!!

ft9GHymgz28W3co6t4l67g.text: Best shabu in town! I really enjoy the atmosphere and the service is great. I had a great experience here and really liked the food. Their veggies and kobe were top notch! I couldn't remember my servers name (I think it was Jerry?), but he was great. I would definitely recommend to try this place out!

-t4L3s-qWB67oPZtTfQq9Q.text: Hannah is a great server and the food is amazing. Be warned, you have to bring your own cheese because they don't have any.

a1KfLsh85jpsGnl1Cr4r5A.text: I've always enjoyed the concept of going out to eat just to cook my own food. I love hot pot restaurants. I usually go to another place and have been a regular there but I decided to give this place a try. "Something new"  My mom and I get to the restaurant for a late lunch/early dinner. We were the only ones in there. Our server was attentive, checked on us frequently.  Only thing that bothered us was that we could hear what the workers were talking about. I don't need to know nor do I care about your promiscuous sounding night at the club and how the guy you met there wants you to meet up with him later that night at another club. I thought that was kind of irritating. I was a server before too, and when me and my coworkers would talk, we would go to an area called "the back" or aka the "kitchen" and talk, not in front of customers. Very unprofessional.  The food was good. The sauces were good. They have a good iced green tea. They arrange the vegetables in a bowl and make it look pretty. I don't think there's enough vegetables in there. Even when my mom and I got an additional bowl of vegetables for $4.99, I know they put a little more, but I don't think that bowl of vegetables is worth $5 Only thing is I wish they had shrimp. This is the first hot pot place I've been to that hadn't offered shrimp.   This was a "nice try" restaurant. But I think I'll stick with my usual spot. Service and food were great though :)

oyksiWjYcLMOSQ5GcYDb8g.text: Michael our server was great!  The food and service was excellent.  Would come back again.

PqLhFO5ql5kLn-hID2LQ9w.text: This place is a1, especially on a cold day.   The best thing about it is their quality and quantity of meat. You're able to get a long tray of good quality beef (Yojie Cut) that melts in your mouth. The salmon and pork belly were also very tasty. You also get a large bowl of veggies that are very fresh. My favorite broths are the tonkotsu and the sukiyaki (especially because of the egg).   I was hesitant to dip it in the raw egg after cooking it in the sukiyaki, but I was so wrong. Go try it. It'll be the best thing that ever happens to you tbh. So don't be scared of it, it's perfectly safe and delicious!  The interior is very nice and clean; everyone is seated bar style. Service is also very nice and helpful!   Overall, probably the best shabu shabu in town!!

Axq9XxpdSAGCL3OaiSEfug.text: If you have never had an asian fondue experience, you can walk through these doors confident and adventurous. The servers here are very well informed and love telling new customers everything there is to know about this amazingly delicious fondue experience. Our server's name was Carl, and he was awesome at showing us the ropes.  The atmosphere is grand for a small space. There is a lovely modern look inside an intimate bar-style area, and you even get the choice of picking a high or low top chair!!! As a shortie, I chose the latter.  I have yet to try their meat options, but will be doing so very soon. this trip, I ordered the veggie medley with the spicy miso broth. I loved the variety of hearty vegetables I got, and it made a wonderful To-go soup after my fondue experience!! If you like things added with an extra kick, they have an awesome punch to add to your fondues and sauces. ;)  All in all, this place is great. The servers are friendly and excited to work here, and the atmosphere is comfortable. I love that I found a late night spot to eat something healthy. Next on my check list when I come back, green tea white chocolate fondue, salmon fondue, and hopefully some yummy cocktails (when they get their liquor license).

PWUVQOTKYKq2hg3BH58eKA.text: This place is not all you can eat but the meat is really high quality. For most a large order of meat is plenty plus your order comes with rice, veggies and noodles. The decor is very modern in a small Bistro size place. If you like spicy ask for the spicy sauce which is a private label that they will also sell you to take home.

Eg3gcvU199Mk0Miemddw1Q.text: Great Japanese Shabu Shabu place, my family loved going to this place. Ordered Yojies Cut Sumo style, lots of veggies and meat, and has great sauces on the sides

dsV9sw28qtZxk2MUfpClhA.text: Holy cow this place is amazing. The service was impeccable and the food just as good. Fun environment for the whole fam damly. My younger brother and I had dinner early on a Saturday night while the parental unit had other plans. Him being a teenager who doesn't excited about everything was pretty stoked on the food and the experience. If you can get to show any type of emotion out side of an ok or fine then by heck it's dang good.

vIivMdcKfyRZ5_SBnJbhKQ.text: Friendly staff, awesome food, great service.  It's well worth the drive from the strip.

61HBTQQ-LK4q1oPKNlG8_A.text: Before anyone decides to read this review here is a disclaimer you need to read...I have never eaten here before...Jo Koy was the guest on the podcast of Tiger Belly and I immediately knew this restaurant was going to be 5 stars...Go Mammoth Meat! $10,000 a slice!

GYDzgnqj9R8m5zGPOOR5Qg.text: I love to eat at Yojie! The workers always welcome you and are very helpful. If you tell them that it is your first time, they have a wooden block that says "first time" and will be placed in front of you. I find that cool because they pay a lot of attention to you along with their other guests. Service here is really good!  Food: Their food is amazing. You can choose different type of broths, meats, and dipping sauces! You also get vegetables with noodles for your broth. I usually get the Yojie's cut with the tonkatsu broth and swisher sauce.  ALWAYS get dessert. I love their fondue. For dessert, I either get their assorted dessert or strawberries with milk chocolate fondue. Their green tea fondue is also very good :)  I've been here a few times and will definitely come back. I am determined to try everything that is on the menu because I know that it will be amazing!

rngN4M04ms4ZCUc-HCOO9g.text: Had the Kobe Beef with Sukiyaki broth.  It was amazing.  Also, the service was top notch.  Highly recommend.

Fi4a3DQncJlfMY_WDmEK5A.text: Spicy miso with a samurai Yojie very good and tasty. I had to cook myself and I've never understood the enjoyment of cooking your own food at a restaurant lol.  I added the garlic and scallions they give you for the sauce to my miso and it was delicious.

Mc8iDTgGGpRCtLWirRaa6Q.text: My husband and I LOVE this place. We usually eat here few times a month. My usual order would be the Spicy Miso, Yojie's cut, and regular Geisha. It's the perfect size every time we eat. The two sauces I enjoy are the ponzu and goma. The servers are very attentive and always check if you need anything else. Thank you Yojie, never disappoints!

yQ8vstwY-qP85-eyclAU0A.text: Being fans of Jo Koy, we decided to check out his restaurant Yojie.   The restaurant had a modern decor to it with interesting asian art on the walls. The shabu area is setup like a bar so you are eating at a counter instead of a table. It kind of makes it hard to talk to people if you have a party of 3 or more. One thing I loved about the restaurant is that each seat area had a usb adapter where you can charge your phone while you eat. I am glad they though of that. I think every restaurant should have that.   The food was good and the portions was just right. It was enough to fill us up. Prices are similar to other shabu-shabu places.   The service was great. The servers were very attentive and friendly.

wqxNeafU56DVUFcDrBM_4Q.text: I like this place very much. I would go back there.the chicken is very good and the sauce that is sweet. I also like how you get your own pot.the sauce is called sukiyaki

Au_HuqyCgQwZle3kfkX7_A.text: Absolutely loved this place.  At first I thought it was all you can eat, but it turns out that it isn't, but that didn't matter.  The food was excellent.  I am a huge shabu shabu fan and have eaten it many times in Japan.  This place really matches the quality of meat that you would get in Japan.  It was very good.  The service was excellent.  I loved the bar like atmosphere and the friendliness of the service.  I will be going to Yojie's again the next time I visit Vegas.

6eQagzOlF3vXjS7gjunmSQ.text: ONE OF MY FAVORITE RESTAURANTS IN LAS VEGAS! If you're a ramen/Korean bbq/any-kind-of-soup lover, this is the best place for you. I have tried eating here few months ago and will never hesitate coming back any time. This resto gives you a nice food experience due to good ambiance, excellent service provided by staff, and most especially their delicious food! You will be given a menu with a guide on how to get the best experience. If its your first time, staff are always ready to help. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, PLEASE TRY AND DON'T MISS GOOD FOOD.

TYGq5SoKgVnChjCEuTFkKg.text: I love love love coming here. When I first came to Yojie' I didn't know too much about shabu shabu, but the staff here did a fantastic job catering to my party and explaining everything step by step. If you're hesitant about trying shabu shabu because you don't know what to do, don't worry. The staff at Yojie' has your back.   Food: 5/5 I really like the Kobe' Beef and dipping it with either the spicy miso or tonkotsu option. But the recommended plate which is the Yojie's Cut is also really good as well! All of the plates come with vegetables, rice, and noodles. The dip here is so satisfying, I always want to come back for more.  The dessert is just as delicious as the entrees! I usually get the fruits and pastries ($7.99) with milk chocolate. The plate it comes out on is decorated so beautifully you almost don't want to eat it.   Staff: 5/5 A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. Their staff is beyond friendly and helpful! They literally explain everything to you down to the T. They let you know how long to cook the items for, what items are highly recommended, etc. Also, they're quick to tend to your needs. I have never had my water glass empty here.   Environment: 5/5 The restaurant has a very modern take on it. From the decorations to the set up of the tables. The set up is two rows, one on the left and one of the right and a small section connected to it  all with individual chairs and a stove in front of the chair. There is a middle section for the staff to walk in. I also really enjoy the music they play here, it is very appealing!

bUSl4zUYvsilEPdKWJOivg.text: Yojie is a Japanese fondue restaurant owned by the comedian, Jokoy. I have been there a few times, and it's been a good experience every time. It's simple and satisfying. You have 3 options of broth and about 5 meat options. Every order comes with a bowl of vegetables and noodles. Every time I go, I get the combination for $20 and order pork belly and steak as my meat.  The restaurant is a small area with one u-shaped table to seat probably 30 people. I'm not sure if this is possible, but it would be fun to reserve the place and have a Japanese fondue party. The interior is super cute and clean. It's a perfect place to go with family, friends, or on a date!

photos.caption: Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination: pork belly and steak

MO7KO5QfzcqcbDvhyCNqKg.text: This place was delicious! Enjoyed every part of the meal, the cherry blossom tea was good, menu was very informative and the purple yam ice cream was amazing! Will be coming back!

vPw4qdvu6H4BaM1UQoWyMw.text: Went there for lunch and it was pretty quite. The place is very clean and food was fresh. I always like Japanese shabu shabu and this is one of few in Vegas that consider authentic. They have different kind of sauce for you to choose from, little surprised that they charge for certain type. Overall, nice neighborhood restaurant.

7sPTf6Yq2sUdyhTkkXAaBg.text: Great place for sukiyaki. The meat was good quality and service was great. Decent serving size for their shabu shabu! Great ambience in the restaurant and very clean.

bLTysBXeUZZohp_RgWESbA.text: First off this place is incredible! When you first walk in is a very unique looking experience. You either sit at a one-sided hightop bar with your own personal heating service or a low top bar with the same set up. It is a very communal atmosphere. This is a wonderful place to take a date or to grab something for yourself. This year Joy is in making your own food. Be sure to take your time. All the food comes out at one time raw and if you Mary Lee dump it all in at once it kind of ruins the fondue experience. I had seen set ups like this before on Anthony board Danes show and Andrew Zimmerman's bizarre foods and always wanted to find a place like this. I happened to stumble upon it while grabbing coffee at a shop close to next door. The staff is incredibly polite and very professional. One would be hard-pressed to try all the amalgamations of the food options including the broths, protein, types of rice and noodles, and vegetables etc. an absolutely stellar experience. I wish I lived there so I could eat there all the time :-)

Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TV4QEw1LH1z8CahdXQoweQ.text: Love! Love! Love! Today was me and our two friends first time at Yojie. It was such a great experience and very unique. We were immediately greeted at the door when we walked in. Our server Mary was this cute, petite, and friendly girl with a big smile. She explained the concept  very well and recommended me to get a XL portion (the Sumo) which filled me for sure. Trying pasteurized egg as a dipping sauce was something new. Since it was our first time we had also beer, sake, and even the fondue dessert. We love green tea! Would highly recommend it to our friends and family if they want something new. We can't wait to come back and get the same server Mary. We loved her and loved Yojie :)

YCjFzihHO_79iySiceJ1DQ.text: Omg! This place is off the hook !!!! So excited we came in here to eat! From the second we walked in we were treated with warmth and smiles. Shannon is the best! He greeted us so well we instantly felt welcome. Which made for a great beginning  to our meal. Along the way we met Thai and Kelsey who were also fantastic!  The food is also sooo yummy. This place is soooo great if we lived here we'd eat here ALL THE TIME!  Next time we are in vegas we will definitely be back!!!

LnR54OUxLWcZkNya65R3vA.text: A must for family or couple. A favorite local hangout. The atmosphere is friendly. You can enjoy each other or get to know your neighbors. Food is enjoyable. Variety is fairly typical of this type of establishment. No big surprises. However, they are excellent with what they offer!  Seating is limited, though.  On the other hand, we also see it as a strong point. We preferred to enjoy our food rather than feeling like rushing and dodging in a busy supermarket or being herded like cattle!

rQSm-gBuLQOIlAfdmkmW9g.text: The perfect meal on a cold winter night is Yojie Japanese Fondue!  Nestled in the Village Square shopping center, I was excited to try their shabu shabu and it did not disappoint.  The interior is nicely decorated and the tabletop electric stoves complement the decor rather than other similar restaurants that have gas stoves.  I decided to try the shabu shabu with Yojie select beef slices in a large portion.  The meat quality was very good and cooked quickly in the seaweed broth.  I requested the ponzu and sesame sauces for dipping and these were both delicious.  Presentation of the side veggies was excellent and they looked very fresh.  I was also surprised with the choice of white or brown rice which other places don't give.  Overall, Yojie is an excellent restaurant for shabu shabu and I'm excited to try the sukiyaki next time!

3zUKYXzyfzJ2PbOt-W6B8Q.text: I had the geisha sized chicken breast with spicy miso broth. It was very delicious. The spice level was not unbearable either. The atmosphere was also nice. The weight staff was very attentive.

2jrtuGYkpgOUy16KO00e1w.text: This place is great. Wonderful atmosphere, great service and phenomenal food.   Not a ton of seats and they don't do reservations so if you're going at a busy time get there early! I had the combo plate which comes with Yojie's cut (beef) and pork, and spicy miso broth. The meat was fresh and amazing and the broth was great.   Our server was Ty and he was extremely helpful and kind!   Highly recommend this place

FC31-sBuWwTuFfmU8pszUg.text: This place has been bookmarked forever and I'm glad I finally went. It is hotpot/fondue style restsurant. Each person gets their own pot in front of them. The place is pretty small so if you have a large group, you may have to wait. With any hotpot place, you choose the meat and sides that you want. The meat was fresh and the portion was decent. They have 4 broths to pick from. I got the spicy miso which was bomb! It wasn't too spicy. Each plate ordered comes with veggies, noodles, and a choice of white or brown rice. You also get 2 choices of dipping sauce. Three people in our group were 1st timers and the staff was super friendly, helpful, and quick. We all had a great experience, and will be back in the future soon. They have nice art work hanging on the walls. Too bad we didn't get to see JoKoy haha. They serve liquor which is a plus and they also have dessert!

GPljT8Iov81AnHGnFF40gA.text: I've had shabu shabu before but this one is a new and fun experience! I order the Kodomo (small) yojie's cut (angus) with spicy miso broth and it was delicious and a lot healthier than what I've been eating lately.   Lots of vegetables to cook in my broth: cabbage, mushrooms, carrots, onions , seaweed, and spinach.   Noodles to cook in my broth: udon and this thin translucent type.   The meat and sauces were delicious. The staff were very helpful in getting us set up, each with our own grills.   Very clean, modern, AIR CONDITIONED, well-ventilated restaurant.   Come give it a try!

NdSBHMPAdgS6ogV4hjFQKA.text: I went here last week on a Sunday afternoon. The place was easy to find and there's plenty of parking in the area.   When I first walked in, I really liked their modern decor. The place was very clean. White countertops offering hightop and lower bar seating. It's not super huge so it's not a place for large group settings. They were playing sort of edm/trap/house music. Not obnoxiously loud or anything, I mean it was still day light when I went. It was pretty quiet, only a party of four dining when we walked in. So I'm glad there wasn't a wait.  So to start I am not a shabu shabu expert so the server gave us the run down. There were only two servers working when we were eating there and both were really nice and friendly.   They have a selection of meats to choose from angus beef, pork, and even vegetarian options. After choosing the meat you chose your soup base or sauce. The server said the most popular was the sukiyaki which is a sweeter flavor and it comes with pasteurized egg for dipping (I was weirded out at first). I got the pork kurobuta lunch portion with the spicy miso. Mine came in a choice of sauces, I got the goma and the swisher. My boyfriend got the sukiyaki (he's such a follower lol) with the combo which includes the yojie cut of angus beef and your choice of another meat, he got pork belly. All the entrees come with a bowl of mixed veggies and udon. You also get a bowl of rice, which I think was free refills.   The spicy miso is where it's at! It went so well with pork and then I dipped in the swisher sauce. I tried the sukiyaki as well which was pretty tasty with the beef and the egg was ok it's just still weird to me. For me in a soup lover and sukiyaki is just so sweet I can't slurp that for too long. Even my boyfriend was so jealous because the spicy miso was better than his sukiyaki. I made a soup with my veggies and udon. It was perfect for this cold weather. Between the pork belly and kurobuta, I prefer the kurobuta.  The angus beef was ok to me it wasn't anything to wow about.   It can be a little pricey for the amount of meat you get especially if you don't do a combo option but for me I ate all my veggies and udon so I felt full. A good thing to do is if you're dining with another person is to get one combo and then one regular portion, then split it.

Te1YeZl4QEIU5Ohx-K8vYg.text: Kids picked the spot for Father's day dinner. .and was a perfect spot! Food was delicious and the experience was top notch.  Nice spot with comforting atmosphere.  Jocoy (one of my favorite comedian) is one of the owners .. very nice guy and even gave us copies of his dvd. This eatery is a must go! Original paintings and photos fit the ambiance of the whole setting.. will be returning .. thank you Carl (our server) and Jocoy and Antwan!!  This place is great!! Best of luck!

K82CVU-y7N1GarQ7WwJJpw.text: Great place, especially if you are a shabu-shabu virgin!  When looking for a meal and you want a "quickie", this is not the place.  Here, you should take your time, really savor and enjoy what you're eating.  The space is very modern.  The seating is at two counters, one high and one low.  Each seat gets their own fondue bowl, which is different from most other places that have one bowl for the table.  The art work on the wall is modern with a Japanese theme and I had fun watching Anime and the original American version of Godzilla on the overhead monitors.  The nice thing is you have never had Japanese fondue "shabu-shabu", the staff explains everything to you.    When you enter the place, the staff yells at you "irasshaimase!", which is the same "welcome" you usually hear when you enter a sushi restaurant.  The first thing after the staff greats you and seats you is explain the menu pointing out the different meat selections, the different cooking dips, and the different finishing dips.  I was a purist the two times I've been and chose the traditional "shabu-shabu", but they have other dips like sukiyaki and spicy miso.  No need to explain the process here because enough reviewers have explained the process of dipping your meat at this place.  I was surprised at how much I liked the green tea and white chocolate fondue dessert.    I've had chocolate fondue before but I've never had white chocolate/green tea fondue before and it was great!  It is rich and pairs very well with the fruits and crispy rice squares.    So, if you are a Japanese fondue virgin, come in and let the staff gently lead you to your happy place!

MDkaYLBORy7VHaeY7TULIw.text: To say that dining at Yojie was a delightful experience is an understatement. The server, Carl, who assisted my boyfriend and I was exceptional. He was eloquent and very helpful in presenting the Shabu Shabu experience; you should always want a server who who enjoys the cuisine as much as you do. The food was just as tasty as they were described in the menu. After everything was cooked to perfection, a symphony of flavors was occurring in our taste buds. One thing I really appreciate is that the restaurant does not waste food whatsoever. If you happen to have some leftovers, the servers will offer to turn your left over meats and vegetables into a savory soup dish. That is a respectable and genius idea.  As far as location goes, my significant other and I are very appreciative that Yojie is not located in the Strip. The last thing we need is an over intoxicated tourist slovenly dunking his or her meat in a boiling broth while laughing like a hyena from the Lion King. Can't wait to enjoy another dinner at Yojie!

Otfim2TzTh14iUmwJ8p-7Q.text: Awesome Shabu! Best in Vegas by far.  Figured I'd have to go back to Orange County to eat decent Shabu, but this place hit the spot.   Heard about it on the Adam Carolla podcast; had to check it out to support the "Joy" pirate ship.   Had the house beef and finished off the meal with the green tea/white chocolate fondue.

kU-z6miMcKY94Q9h8AvItw.text: ATMOSPHERE:  This place has everything that I enjoy about a restaurant.  Clean eating area, great music, not too loud, cool decor and sleek impressions.  It's a relaxed atmosphere without being too dull.  The only real thing that threw me off was that anime was playing on the tv screens (I came in on a Sunday, at least have some football on!)  But this is a really minor point because everything else was exceptional.  FOOD:  I've never tried shabu shabu before this visit.  Yojie was on my radar for a while but I finally was able to try it out.  I was with my girlfriend and we got the combo with Pork Belly and sukiyaki sauce.  The normal accompaniments (white rice, vegetables, noodles) were nice and fresh.  The meats themselves were cut really well and cooked super fast and tasted great with the sauce.  Trust me when I tell you the sauce was BOMB!  SO GOOD in fact that I'm still thinking about it now.  If you go, make sure to try the sukiyaki with the egg.  The egg is a must have with the meal.  We also got some mochi, which was a nice way to end the meal.  SERVICE:  Top notch service all-around.  I wish I would have gotten their names but our server was great.  She gave us a demo before we started, made sure everything was up to our standards and joked around with us a little bit.  Our other server gave us a rundown of the menu and what it all means (we were noobies).  I'd like to see how this restaurant does during a really busy time but I'll gladly take the service we got during the lunch hours.

10H9BbmBhpN7IWB3NifbqQ.text: This place is better than the other Shabu Shabu restaurants in town. Only trouble is they still don't have alcohol. Kind of a bummer not to have a cold beer while eating spicy Shabu Shabu.
