S5ZDtaNJcgmNpDMVZw5bpw.text: Yum! This is our second time back this week...haha.   We came in for lunch today. We got the prime rib and Yojie's cut (both with the sukiyaki broth). The meals come with your choice of brown or white rice and veggies.  It's light, premium, and fun to eat.   The seating is interesting. There's a row of high tops and a row of low tops. It's fine for two to a few people but the first time we came in, it was with a group of nine...so it wasn't very social. It's also cold inside but once you start cooking, you'll warm up!  Overall, we will be back! The staff is very friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Samurai yojie&#39;s cut with sukiyaki broth .

NH-fFuC7DNFlJit3d3H6HQ.text: First time here on a Friday night, craving a light dinner. Tried the Yojie's cut & Sukiyaki broth. The broth, man was that sweet, I call it the "diabetes"broth. It is so sweet, in my attempt to dilute the broth, I dumped a whole glass of water with the ice in the pot without even thinking. Even with a whole cup of water it still remained super sweet. Three of us all ordered the signature Sukiyaki broth and by the end of the night, all had the same complaint, too sweet and overpowering.  They really skim on the veggies, really sad. Felt like there was like 6-7 pieces of cut veggies, 2 shaved pieces of carrots, 1 cube of tofu, and that was it. Comparing to other hot pot restaurants, a whole plate of veggies usually accompanies the meal. The veggies here looked like mere decorations to your noodles.  Overall great cuts of meats, great ambiance, hip and clean, other than that would not be returning. The competition is strong out there my friends.

kMHyfN8OysufZEObAgbpCg.text: Food was great! I really loved how they offered an alternative to meat! I had the salmon and it was delicious! Service was great and I loved how they explained the menu so there wasn't any confusion! Come with an appetite because they give you plenty of food for what you pay for! Makes a great spot for date night!

UwshVU3Vubi6rdiiEhMuDg.text: This place got me addicted to hot pot. I get the cravings for that spicy miso broth!! It gives me withdrawls when it's been too long since my last encounter. (its actually to the point some of the servers recognize me :3)  Also, the green tea fondue is SOOOOO much yum.  See you soon Yojie

oYKvWrAu5akwbQGA_PSo1Q.text: Pretty good food, big fan of Jokoy, fondue is delicious, overall experience is amazing! My only complaint is that I wish there were just more space within this fabulous establishment!

LcNII7fODWM-3j97D76wPA.text: This is my third try at a Las Vegas Shabu Shabu/ hot pot place and for some reason shabu shabu in Las Vegas tends to be on the pricey-side for what one would expect.  Came here and got the Prime rib in Samurai portion (7oz for $24.99) with the pork (tonkotsu) broth which costs $3 extra. Had the brown rice and asked to replace udon with clear noodle but that wasn't an option. Personally, I believe the meal had too much carbs and was quite scant with the actual protein and vegetables which was disappointing to me. The ponzu dipping sauce, which I generally liked a lot, was lacking in yuzu flavor and sodium soy-sauce heavy.  The meat was fine but the broth leans on the salty side. The green tea was kind of interesting as it had came in a cool contraption which allows the liquid to stream down to the cup when placed over the rim.  If I had anything positive to say about Yojie, it is that service was excellent. The lady who served our meals was really friendly and prompt.

Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib in Samurai portion (7oz.) with the pork (tonkotsu) broth

dx1tcFCQP3QCDUPe0AOm3w.text: Wow.  Better than I expected.  Servers were very informative and walked us through the process. I got the small portion of meat but it was plenty with the rest of the vegetables, noodles, and tofu. Next time I order 1/2 the amount of rice that comes with the dinner. Highly recommended!

zYgorlEF85vR1s4UWkEpTQ.text: No it's not AYCE but this place makes up for it in quality and flavor. The spicy miso broth was delicious and my salmon was thinly sliced and so, so tender. *mouth is watering as I recall* I think the portions of noodles, veggies, and meat (ordered regular size) are just right. With the included bowl of rice, I was perfectly full. (They do offer large portions of the meat if you're on the hungrier side) And to top it off, we had their ube ice cream which was delicious.  The service was also superb.  10/10 will be coming back.

AnbrS20iKRWDol2eV-2_pA.text: Nothing beats yojies, nothing!!!!  After trying a many hot pot places, yojies is still number one and top of my list. No place beats their quality, service, and interior design. They pretty much figured it all out. While it may be on the pricier side, most hot pot places do charge a fairly high amount for their meats, but yojies definitely is worth your time for the experience you get.  I always crave this place when I think of meat. Better than kbbq, the meat quality is something that makes you want to keep coming back. Never dry, never hard. I love their sauces which are so delicious, goma and ponzu would be my sauces of choice.   Unlimited rice, multiple veggies and noodles, this place will definitely fill you up right!

Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie medley
Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s all about the cute little details

smHh-d6JiMO1y87cuAiktA.text: Music and hot pot is definitely the highlight of my experience here.  The use of old school hip hop and R&B and raw egg as a dipping sauce is fantastic.  But the icing on the cake is when you watch people who don't know how to eat Japanese Fondue with a piece of raw egg in front of them.  My go to here is the prime rib and sukiyaki with a cherry blossom tea.  If you've never ate here, don't be shy to ask staff on how to eat things.  However, it's important to note that you just add veggies to your soup to flavor it up for your meat which should be swished in the broth for about 10 seconds only.  The raw egg is used as a dipping sauce for your veggies and meat!  Magic!  The only negative part that I would say is the side by side seating.  So if you have a party of more than 1 then you would have to lean forward or back to communicate with the person you're not sitting next to.

brl_esuBUlLz25Hr1rgcNA.text: If you like Hot Pot... Yojie is the place to go. The place is clean, the service is great and the food is outstanding. I had the Kobe beef and it literally melted in my mouth.  5 stars.

Qx9Rep5sGpTvQoRmd0muxQ.text: This is my second time here. Food is really good. My favorite is the Sukiyaki with the pasteurized egg as dipping sauce. As for the beef, I usually ordered the Kobe Beef and the Prime rib.   Service was great as well. Server constantly checked on us.   Too bad it is a little far away from where I live but definitely worth the drive. I would definitely come back here agai

HMnm1n3pGOHJ-RWUGGvZNA.text: Currently my favourite hot spot place to go to. Yojie is extremely consistent with its food quality and service. I wish they had a location closer to the strip, but making the drive over is pretty worth it.  I usually go for the yojie cut with spicy miso broth. The meat has nice marble to it and tastes reaaaaally good with the spicy miso broth. I've tried sukiyaki before, and it was actually a little too sweet for my taste. It also comes with udon noodles, a bunch of veggies, and rice, which are all unlimited. I do also recommend the desserts. It's been a while before I got the green tea fondue, but that was good. On my latest trip, I ordered the ube ice cream which came with three scoops and a tiny mint leaf on top. Yummy.  The service here is usually pretty friendly and quick. The space is small, and it isn't hard getting the servers' attention. I asked if they could change the channel to an NBA playoff game, and they changed the channel right after I asked. Great service!  The interior is very modern and stylish. There are a few pieces on the wall that look cool. They're always playing great music, usually 90s-2000s R&B/hip hop.   Consistently delivers high quality food, service, and a great vibe!

photos.caption: Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ube ice cream

leSZxyDGOguMZM6ghGME7Q.text: This a very clean, well thought out restaurant. The art work is cool. I've have eaten at a lot of hotpot and sukiyaki places and this is a decent spot. The soup base (sukiyaki) was well balanced. The cuts of meat were well presented. The added touch with the pasteurized egg for the sukiyaki sold me. Go check it out.

yh4RfnJ39nMLDJP5FZV16A.text: Updated review : 2nd visit- definitely better meat quality than the rest of the places down on spring mountain but they are skimping on veggies.  they took out bok choy (which is cheap) and barley give you any Napa cabbage. The udon they use is super cheap quality cause it's soggy after 40 secs.   I was the only customer during lunch and ordered the Yojie samurai cut for lunch $18+tax. I had them charge without looking at the bill and came out to 22.50 and left a separate $2 tip. Got to my car and realized that even at 10% sales tax it's should of came out to $20.... she either overcharged or there was a built in tip that I was not informed about.  Maybe if you get off your phone and stop talking to the line cook in the back you'd notice- won't be returning again for this kind of service.

OmwxRxln6fC9HYdir0QA5A.text: This place is Better then shabu shabu. Not a big place but perfect for its size. Fits abt 28-30 ppl at one time. Sounds small but their quality of food is high. Preferably call ahead if you have a big party. If your ordering kobe beef don't feel insulted when they have to remind you the price per oz. I guessed ppl used to Oder it then when the bill comes they act like they didn't know the difference. Amazing little place.

rTRGOEWpQmGut4n2ZKSLYw.text: There's not many places to choose from when it comes to shabu/suziyaki in Vegas. I was surprised to learn that this place existed and my first initial thought was that this was a dessert type of restaurant. That's just part of the menu. It's located in a huge plaza full of other restaurants and stores.  The time it took to be seated took a while because there's not that many seats available. It wasn't crowded but my group had to wait for enough seats to open up. The customer service wasn't terrible but it could be faster. They weren't as attentive in the beginning and I waited for a while before the food came out. One of the serves definitely caught me eye as she was very cheerful and interactive with the customers. She attended to my group towards the end and unexpectedly offered free mochi ice cream.  The food itself tastes delicious!! I've had shabu several times before in California and this place was definitely up to their standards! It is on the pricer side, but I believe that it's reasonable for the quality that they provide. I ordered a suziyaki large Yojie cut which had me full and content.

MR3ChEFboxqHetiCp_EkFw.text: Just amazing.. I've already come here about 3 times I'm not even sure if I checked in on the third time I was just excited to get things going. So I feel like the 5 stars really have to be earned in every aspect of a restaurant from how clean it is in the eating area as well as bathrooms, customer service and attention to detail, atmosphere, then finally the food presentation and taste... this place has it all..  The lighting was perfect.. this is no joke but there was soft music playing in the background and if you listened closely.. it was tupac.. I was blown away... this place made tupac sound like Marvin Gaye just by adjusting the lighting.. blown away.. 90s hip-hop literally played softly in the background lol it was the best. All of that warm fun stuff aside the broth was great.. look I can't explain everything about a place where you just make your own soup lol you'll have to take my word for it AND get the chocolate dipped strawberries..

The first time I came here I got the salmon, which I've never seen as an option at any other shabu shabu places and it was really good. 1J0dNiAoKUuHEpy7soA0eA.text: My favorite Shabu Shabu spot! I would eat this everyday if I could. I always get the Yojie cut and spicy miso as my broth. It comes with a bowl of vegetables and udon noodles, a side of rice, and 2 sauces of your choice.   The service never disappoints! Wish I got our server's name because I've had him the last couple of visits and he's awesome. The location is pretty far from where I live, but the drive is always worth it because the food is so yummy!!

bPxT5EX4riO62EQ75cxSXA.text: This is a Very Unique Dining Experience...   First You Sign in... Unusual to be sure.   Next you are seated at a long bar, where each person has their own small cooktop, situated close to the serving side of the bar.   The choices are the types of meat & the sauces which you cook them in... Shabu Shabu  We met wonderful Chef O... He tuned up my Sukiyaki & it was fabulous. My husband tried the spicy miso broth so I cooked some in it.  It was Ok.  I would not order it as the slightly richer & sweeter Sukiyaki broth is such a delightful flavor.   We loved the assortment of vegetables & would request additional shiitake mushrooms when we return as the Sukiyaki broth is richer with more of these type of mushrooms.  Writing about this makes me want to go again soon... Do you know how good it is!   We tried the desert fondue & it was great!   Also the bubblegum tasting Japanese soda with a small scoop of ice cream. Like a root beer float, Japanese style. It was refreshing... Ok   The highlight here is the nice clean set up. The great service from Chef O... The incredibly delicious Sukiyaki.  There is an amazing Sushi restaurant in this same mall. Hanabi. I would like to start at Hanabi... Have some Sushi and go to this restaurant for Sukiyaki. They should have a Japanese progressive dinner event! Both places are Excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The set up for Sukiyaki cooked by us... The patrons:)

MKyTLpu0uKvZp1dGmWVMww.text: Completely in love!!! I'm a complete Shabu Shabu fiend. I've been trying to find places that would compare to San Francisco and honestly, it's been a struggle. I've heard so many great things about this place from my peers and this place seriously did not disappoint me one bit.   The service was impeccable. The chef and the server really pay attention to your broth from being low and they actually do a little Shabu Shabu 101 with you if you've never had something like it before. Never had to ask for water and the servers actually talk to you and are super friendly and helpful.   Since I've never been to this location, our lady server talked about the menu in detail. You have choices of four different broth types. The Shabu Shabu broth, sukiyaki, spicy miso, and tonkotsu. The meats vary in price and size. She recommended to me the combination choices of meat where you could choose pork belly, pork, chicken, and salmon. It also comes along side with yojies angus meat.   My order? I ended up choosing the spicy miso along side my two dipping sauces of ponzu and peanut sauce base. The spicy miso was super flavorful. Went so well with the veggies, meat, and udon noodles that came with it. I went with her recommendation and ordered the combo meat. Need I tell you, it was super filling! At the very end of my meal, we ordered the fruits and pastries fondue. The fondue base was a green tea white chocolate. I seriously never had something like that before. I was so happy inside! What I recommend? Cut the pastry in half and the fruits to dip in the fondue together. It creates a balance. It's so gooooood!  I was completely impressed at the service, the design of the restaurant, and most importantly the food. Will definitely come back here again. I completely love it and will be the best Shabu spot here in Vegas for me :).

8KzmgxKU8jp1DNX7d7ln3g.text: This is a really really great place to go to if you are craving something a little bit different! The food is shabu shabu style, where you are given very thin slices of meat, a bowl of noodles and vegetables, and a mini stove with boiling broth, and you cook your meal in the broth. Super interactive and delicious, and you get a choice of broth and choice of meat. I have tried the Yojie's cut, the wagyu cut, the spicy miso broth, and the tonkatsu; all are really tasty! The staff is extremely helpful especially if you've never been to a shabu shabu place before, and they'll even put a cute sign on your station that says, "first time" where they'll walk you through the process step by step. I have also had the dessert which is a green tea fondue with a very cute fruit and cake presentation set up. The area itself is a bit small and the tables are 2 long and extended benches (one higher and one lower) and the price is dependent on the cut of meat you get and whether it's lunch or dinner time; the Yojie's cut for lunch is around $15. Overall, this is a favorite place of mine to go to and I frequently bring friends and family to have a good meal!

fK7LTSGwKH2Dzc3LJaJlXQ.text: This place is cute and the food always satisfies.  I like the interactive experience.  Kind of like Korean bbq without all the oil.  A much healthier alternative.

ufS3ElvSP-AwnR4SYRW7Ng.text: I've been craving this and there aren't many hot pot places in Vegas. I wish there was a closer location to me since I'm closer to Silverado Ranch area so this is almost a 30 minute drive.  The first thing I noticed was how they have induction burners at every seat and the set up is kind of like bar seating. I really liked that. It's a lot nicer than carrying out a burner and only having one burner per table like another place I've been to.  There's three broths to choose from: shabu-shabu, sukiyaki, and spicy miso. I've only had the spicy miso and it comes with 2 dipping sauces, I picked the ponzu (citrus soy sauce) and gomu (sesame sauce). They're all very flavorful and they do offer green onion, garlic, radish, a Japanese chili powder, soy sauce, and the spicy drops. The spicy miso isn't too spicy so I added a bit more spice.  I ordered the combo plate in the lunch geisha size. And it comes with 5oz Yojie's cut angus steak, 5oz salmon sashimi, a bowl of white or brown rice, and a bowl of veggies that has some udon noodles. It's a pretty good size portion even if you just order the Geisha size of a single item, it's about 5 thin sliced pieces of meat. Last time I couldn't finish everything and was able to cook it in the broth and take it home, I guess I was really hungry and finished everything today. I'm not sure what the differences are between the lunch and the dinner sizes. Maybe the dinner has more veggies and noodles?  Overall I really like this place. The food is very flavorful and fresh and they have a good variety on the menu. There's never been a wait when I've come for lunch. It can be a bit tricky to find since it's in a big plaza but it's right next to Joy Yee's.

photos.caption: Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Geisha sized salmon and Yojie angus beef combo with spicy miso broth

mgS7WYv__ExzeNdhKRunnQ.text: This was my first time eating 'hot pot' style. We decided to share and it was just enough food. I would probably add some extra meat next time.   We chose Yojie's cut (angus beef) and pork belly from the combo plate. Sharing is only an additional $4.99 and you get your own rice (white or brown), sauce, and personal pot. We had shabu shabu pot and spicy miso pot. I preferred the miso - it gave the meat a little kick. Shabu was boiling water.  They don't have a liquor license yet so we couldn't order any beer/sake.  They explain the process if you are new to this style of eating. Very friendly and helpful.

dyo-zrm5YkghihM_kgrbfQ.text: I have been waiting to eat here but never had the time. But last week, we finally go the chance to give it a try. So, I say YEYEYEYEY! I love the ambiance and the customer care was on point. They will be your spirit guides into the fun world of Shabu Shabu. As you take into this journey of boiling hot goodness, you will savor flavors from just shabu shabu (which is the plain broth) all the way to Miso Spicy (my fave)--i love that it gives that essential kick you long for in your food. I ordered the Yojie Cut (great angus beef), with the Atlantic Salmon **at sashimi grade** slices, and it was amazing. All the flavors come together when topped with the Goma sauce on RICE! Veggies that come with your meal are fresh and crunchy, so don't over cook! Watch your items like they're your first born child, for with this in mind handling with care AT ALL TIMES. Altogether, finish your journey with some desert. I had the ube ice cream (just coz), but they're well known for their fruits dipped in chocolate fondue so TREAT YoSELF!

RGRtH1h5rGW8y9BrkX1RRw.text: I owe Yojie an updated review now that I've become a regular!    As promised, I went back again and Carl greeted me at the door, "hey! Welcome back!  I promise I won't seat you at the end and I'll take good care of you the WHOLE time. I'll make sure your tea is hot!"  It's a little awkward to be recognized for my critical review, but his desire to change my mind about Yojie was very impressive!  Game on!    Carl kept his word and refilled my tea with piping hot water throughout my meal.  He was attentive to our needs and took care of me from start to finish.   We've become regulars, visiting about 2-4 times per month.  Although Yojie is much more pricey than other shabu shabu places in town, their quality in meat & service is much better, so it's worth it if you can afford to treat yourself every now and then.    Recently I went in and Carl was NOT working. Trust me, this is a very rare occurrence.  He's ALWAYS there.  I was a little hesitant being that the last time he went on a break while I was there, I left feeling like it wasn't that great of an experience.  We decided to stay anyway and we are glad we did!  I can't remember the sweet girls name, but she was great.  She was attentive and helpful, no complaints.  Phew!     Like any new place in town, it always takes a minute to perfect things...and Yojie has.  It's impressive to me that the server cared enough to read the review that was written, remember me, and accommodate my annoying little complaints.  Lol.  I also think he's become the manager since our first visit, so he's doing a great job in making sure the staff are up to par in their service as well.   5 stars, Yojie.  Bravo!

e2oxOfdyeTmUjB7zGiumVQ.text: It was our first time here and we loved it.  If you're looking for something different this is the place to go.  Great food and the service was absolutely superb, they  completely explain the menu and we're very engaging in conversation .

4hmd597wkjX8bK19ClNmIQ.text: I guess I had high expectations.  The soup was bland for my taste.  For the price of each bowl, I found it to be expensive.  Would I return, likely not.

WWIpoL1__NeWlMKmmUd8bg.text: The ambience was modern and I for one enjoy the counter seating concept as I do not like sharing a pot with others.   The service was stellar! Our waitress I believe her name was Valerie was prompt, helpful and nice to talk to. Our green tea was always full.  The reason for the minus 2 stars was the lack of miso flavor in the spicy miso and the lack of veggies. I love Shabu-Shabu and have tried many different locations. The broth missed the spot. It was supposed to be spicy miso but both the spice and miso was missing. The veggie choice and quantity was also lacking. Come one 1 broccoli. 2 total pieces of mushrooms, that does not cut it.   The highlight was the meat. We had the prime rib and it was of good quality.  I will try other Shabu places before deciding if I will be back.

UZ97YcLOimm27go2s2akMg.text: I'm from California so I definitely miss the Shabu from there. Love that they opened a yojie here! I was a regular there and now going to be a regular here! Sad they didn't have the hot drops but they still had a spicy sauce. For those who don't usually Shabu save your noodles until the end and ask for the soup base so you can have your udon soup after. Yum!! I'm also not a dessert person but you have to try their green tea white chocolate fondue!!

JE4RlU5RFwI25EJmtNXJ3A.text: SHABU SHABU!!!   I LOVE shabu.... it would be my go to whenever I can't think of something to eat because it is like a home cooking meal... plus you can keep yourself entertained by cooking your own food if you are eating ALONE!   Just like MOST shabu places that I have dined at... they have individual pots & burners for each person on a high counter top... although lately I have been seeing more places w/ low counter tops which is nice just in case if you can't get onto the high top! This place is clean cut & simply decorated which I always like when there isn't too much clutter! They have one side bright & other side dark, & the counter tops are all white (makes me cautious of how I eat so I don't look like a SLOB ahahahaaa)   Our server "O" (that's his name) was freaken AWESOME so calm & professional yet very friendly & approachable... he made me a little jealous as being a server myself made me admire the way he carried himself. He informed us of what they were about & all the steps of the process... we wanted but he whole experience even though we know everything about shabu after trying so many different places in Cali.  SAMURAI YOJIE'S CUT $20.99 - Hubby got this w/tonkatsu base which is $2.99 more but that DAMN soup base is freaken DERICIOUS!!!!! You just can't stop slurping up the soup. Samurai size is 7 oz. of meat.  GEISHA PORK BELLY (side)$5.99 - I guess if you add a side it's cheaper as we are fatties we wanted more variety & got a side of thinly sliced pork belly that complimented the tonkatsu soup base so well! the geisha is 5 oz. of meat.  SUMO YOJIE'S CUT $23.99 - I eat more than the bois & got the SUMO size which is 10 oz. of meat which is nice that they also state how many oz. everything is so you know how much to expect. This cut although I dunno what exactly it is... it's dericious... ahahaha   SAMURAI PRIME RIB $24.99 - roomie got this & it was good as well... but IMHO I can't really taste the difference when it is shabu... but.. definitely wanna try the wagyu one day which I am SURE you could taste the difference.  GTWC STRAWBERRY & BANANA $6.99 - This was a dessert fondue. umm... I really hated that I had to share... but I at least got to eat/ drink/ slurp down the rest of the Green Tea White Chocolate fondue sauce. =] w/ the help of O I was able to stay classy as he brought me a little spoon to devour the sauce in class.   ICE COFFEE $3.99 - chilled & served w/ cream & simple syrup on the side. CALPICO $3.99 - served w/ a cherry which makes it fun  CHERRY BLOSSOM TEA $3.99 - this was served in the newest technology for tea brewing which I have seen a lot at teavanna where you stick the bottom of the pot to the top of the cup.  I WILL BE BACK TOO MANY TIMES IN THE FUTURE I KNOW IT...

r2lcBt3QWjN_6NvZKcy6DA.text: I ordered the combo plate with salmon and the angus beef. Cuts were perfect and enough to share. You can eat the salmon raw as well. 3sgRnaCqq89dSfivz3sMNQ.text: This is a great little place.  Our son introduced us to this place a few years ago and we have became "regulars".  The food is always good and the service too.  The food is out of our usual comfort zone and we would have never ventured in by ourselves.  Now we actually crave the food.

6TfX1z5ksZs_8zjXAjdvsQ.text: Been a long time since I had Shabu Shabu in Japan, so I read that this place was good so I decided to drive clear across town to check it out. The server was both knowledgeable and helpful. I ordered the medium sized house specialty beef....it was plenty for me and I am a big eater. I also order the medium spicy broth... it was ok... next time I think I will go with the sukiyaki for a change. I want by myself, it would have been more fun with a group I think. The meal comes with assorted raw veggies and noodles to make soup at the end. Also comes with rice. The cost was around $22 for lunch. I will come back for another round!!

wQvBTgM8krtK4nC87-9BOQ.text: I was really hungry and I wanted Sukiyaki soup, which was how I found Yojie Japanese Fondue!   The place is clean!   I opted for the queen portion of the chicken. Order came with chicken (raw and to be cooked shabu shabu style), rice and veggies with noodles. I inhaled my food in less than 20 minutes!!! Will definitely be back for my Sukiyaki fix!

tEmn-mAWe365xrbhiFuP7A.text: I love the idea of shabu shabu, it's a great interactive experience. Very convenient especially during winter time.  SERVICE The workers welcome you when you walk in. If it's your first time they explain how shabu shabu (Japanese fondue) work and the process of it. They are very knowledgable of the menu, and answer all the questions you may have. Awesome customer service and friendly all around.  FOOD I got the YojieCut Geisha with white rice, spicy miso broth, and ponzu & goma sauce. The broth is delicious, it's actually spicy compared to most places. The meat quality is wonderful, the price not so much but it's worth it. Dipping the meat in goma sauce brings a wonderful nutty flavor while the ponzu enhances the meat flavor (in my opinion). The rice is refillable and your meal comes with a vegetable bowl (cabbage, carrots, mushroom, onion, broccoli, and seaweed) and noodles (udon and rice noodles). The Ramune float is a great desert because it's refreshing and not too sweet or heavy after your meal. The strawberries and banana fondue with green tea white chocolate is delicious too.   CONCLUSION I will be back soon, love the food and atmosphere (very modern and chic).

zJziziDW2JmdyjDCdVbBXw.text: Second time here and I had the worst experience. 5 stars for the food, 3 stars for the price, and 1 for the service. Their service was so amazing when they first opened that they were so pushy but you felt like they gave you their undivided attention.  The only person who was nice to me was the gentleman in the supreme hat. The girls that were the servers ignored me four different times when I had questions or needed something, and asked for the bill! Soooooo rude they would just look at me and walk away. They didn't check if my boiler was too high or low because they were no where to be found. XLWMV31fsTveRhF_LSXSvA.text: Impeccably clean Extremely friendly staff Excellent quality  Decent prices! Absolutely amazing and definitely coming back We found our go to hot pot spot TY from BIG I is the man! And jo koy is a man of his word

d4v7U7HfAD7bLvOe42ZK5g.text: Yojie Japanese Fondue is a slick, modern, and clean restaurant.  The design of the restaurant effectively utilizes the small space.  I love the elegant presentation and attention to detail in the restaurant's layout, menu, and food presentation.    First, you select your meat.  I ordered the Yojie's Cut.  Second, you select your broth.  I ordered Tonkatsu Broth.  Third, you select a size. I ordered a Sumo (extra large).  Fourth, you select two dipping sauces.  I ordered Ponzu and Goma.  Orders come with a bowl of rice and a bowl of vegetables and noodles.  You can get free refills of broth, dipping sauces, and rice.    The meat was fresh and not frozen, like at some hot pot restaurants.  The broth was not the best I have had, but was pretty good.  My favorite thing is that each person gets their own broth and own heating plate for their broth, whereas many hot pot restaurants require people to share broths.  Overall, I was not wowed by the food, but I loved the presentation and concept.

zHQdmnRxWJL96HGnHMzFtQ.text: Mood - dinner  Upon entering was greeted with great customer service. Was instructed to sit wherever I chose as it wasn't busy. Opted for the Yojie cut with Sukiyaki broth, brown rice, signature green tea,  tiramisu tea, fruit and pastries fondue. Nothing disappointed at all. The entire experience was brilliant and one to be expected especially if your with good company. The food is displayed with meat on one plate,  add-ons in a high bowl, and broth on the burner. As you slowly add your desired creation, wait for it to cook, and eat. Loved it.   Interior is open middle section for staff to attend to all patrons, while each seating arrangement is in sit up bar style with its own burner. The broth and rice are unlimited. Everything was clean, and great music was playing in the background.   Would thoroughly recommend- plus it's Jo Koy restaurant- one of my fav comedians. Pricing is a reflection of quality and presentation   Location is Sahara/ Ft Apache- ample parking

TG4ONn8aw5l5rX-AylEeVQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE! This is my third time here- first my friend introduced me to this place, then I introduced this to my boyfriend and now I introduced it to my best friend! Upon walking in, the restaurant is clean with a nice and calming atmosphere! The staff there are extremely nice and the food is AMAZING! The seating arrangement is shaped like a U and in the middle, they have the bowls and everything there.   When I go here, I usually get the geisha because it is so filling! They have 3 sizes of meats to pick from, ranging from 10, 15, and 20 slices (A.K.A. small, medium, large). You first pick what kind of meat you want (I usually get the regular meat in a geisha size- I think that has about 10 slices of meat?) and it comes with a heaping bowl of veggies, udon noodles (thick white noodles) and a bowl of brown or white rice. The broth I usually get is the sukiyaki sauce, which is a sweet soy sauce broth with seasonings with the raw egg. There are other broths on the menu as well and I haven't tried them because I just love the sukiyaki broth,  Okay, I know it sounds weird but you get the raw egg, scramble it and dip your cooked meat in it! I throw a lot of the chili powder in the egg too to add a kick of spices. I suggest throwing in the harder veggies to cook first then slowly throwing in the udon noodles as you eat. I say that about the udon noodles because when it's cooked, starch comes out of the noodles so it makes the broth too thick. SOOOO FILLING and soooo yummy! All in all, I will be coming back here, kind of far of a drive but soooooo worth it!

FhAU5ljxp_xrsRfbrD2RHw.text: I've been wanting to try this place for so long and my friends finally took me! I was scared to try it by myself because I have no idea hot this hot pot thing works. But you just have to go with a couple friends and try it out! We went on a Monday night and there was no wait at all. Good thing, too, because I was starving. This is like Korean BBQ, but without the smokey smell and long wait for food to cook. I have nothing to compare this place to, so I'm sure this place is high up there.   Every seat has an electric stove to keep your pot... hot... (LOL). You choose your meat, soup, and sauces. The meat comes sliced up and pretty on a plate. I like my foods spicy, so I got the spicy miso (yummy!) and for my meat: the Yojie Chef's Cut (regular size, it was enough to feed me, but I would get the next size up next time!). I also got a ponzo and some sort of sesame sauce. Everything was so good. The meat is thinly sliced and you just put the meat in your hot pot and it just cooks it! Wow! Your order also comes with vegetables and noodles. You can put all those things in there, then once your done with your meat, eat the noodles and your soup! It was a great meal and I'm definitely going to come again!

ZZfHfqXPCXfUMZExlZwUNA.text: Ya'll, Yojie is the real deal! I've had it bookmarked for a few years but only recently was willing to drive 30 min to get there. I will be driving there more often because it was fantastic.   Three of us visited on a Monday night and there were a few other groups dining but it was not nearly as busy as I expected it to be. They have high and low bar seating so we chose the low and started off with Asahi draft (BOGO!). The servers were very nice and since it's a bar setup it's very easy for them to walk the line and check up on everyone throughout the meal. We explained we've had shabu shabu before but he was kind in explaining the differences in broth (spicy miso, tonkatsu, sukiyaki, and plain water with dipping sauces). I ordered the Yojie cut, geisha size with the sukiyaki broth and pasteurized egg. My boyfriend got the Kobe beef with spicy miso. It always sounds good to get the Kobe beef but I feel that dunking it in a heavy sesame sauce sort of kills any flavor of the meat.   The sukiyaki broth was heavenly: light but full of flavor. Slightly sweet, maybe mirin, sake and soy sauce? And the egg for dipping gives the meat a creamy, buttery taste. SO. GOOD. I think everyone I dined with and the servers all agree the sukiyaki is the way to go. I liked the taste of the spicy miso but with the other two dipping sauces it's a little bit of a flavor whirlwind. The vegetables are fresh and plentiful. They bury udon noodles underneath for the end of the meal, which is good because if you ate them straight away you'd probably get full quickly.   Pro Tips for Sukiyaki or Shabu Shabu:   - You can use your chopsticks to pick up the raw meat and eat the cooked meat. They provide tongs but traditionally you use your chopsticks. - Only cook the meat for a few seconds by gliding it through the broth. Veggies can cook longer.  - Dip the meat in the egg or dipping sauce and rest it in the bowl of rice. The rice soaks up the juices and can be eaten with the meat or separately but it is an important part of the meal!  I do agree that traditionally you would eat sukiyaki or shabu shabu in a communal way with the hot pot in the center of the table but I didn't have a problem eating alongside my companions. It makes the experience more personal and you kind of have blinders on to enjoy it yourself. I also agree that "Japanese fondue" is a bit misleading and I think you can give people more credit - they probably have heard of shabu shabu.   Anyways Yojie is for sure my number one shabu place now and I can't wait to tell everyone about it.

qmaskjxZ_10uumDfHdom5Q.text: VERY clean, service high quality and food amount just right. My girlfriend and I came for lunch and thanks to awesome Ti, we got to try black sesame seed mochi. HdVwIVq3UB0yg8C0XymHDg.text: I wanted to try this restaurant because 4.5 stars, I like vegetable shabu and I'm a Japanese from Japan.  I know what Shabu Shabu is.  First of all, I order Cherry blossom tea.  It came with plastic infuser.  I immediate thought that was bad sign.. Restaurants that serve hot beverages in plastic containers have no idea how plastic harm our body.  I drank a little bit, it was just warm tea... The tea taste like Cherry Blossom tea from The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf.  Vegetable dish came next with a pot with water and a small piece of kombu in it. Water in the pot was much less than usual shabu shabu.  Some Nappa were already cut pieces but 3 giant leaves Nappas were in a middle of the dish on Udon noodles... A waitress asked me if I want scissors. I said no thank you because I was scared that if the scissors were used for meat to cut (I am a vegan) The giant Nappas were difficult to eat. 2 pieces of Shiitake Mushrooms cut halves so 4 pierces of them and 2 very small portions of Enoki Mushrooms (very very small). I expected more different kind of mushrooms. Some Harusame, some pieces of Tofu, 4 thin slice of carrots, some pieces of broccoli, some slices of onion, some wakame...  And finally the important part, Tare (dipping sauce). I ordered Ponzu and Goma (sesame).  The waitress said Ponzu and Goma are house made so I thought must be good.  I dipped my vegetable into Goma.... It was very weird taste... Not even taste of goma... It was more like... taste of very bad broth and cheap miso... ok... I wanted to try ponzu next... The ponzu taste was weird too... I didn't taste of citrus like sour soy sauce... This is too like some kind of bad broth with something I don't know... I asked the waitress what the broth was.. She said Hondashi!!! OMG!!! This restaurant uses Hondashi!!! It contains bonito fish and lots of lots of MSG!!!! That's why the dipping sauce taste were weird, I didn't use them after I found out the broth. May be this restaurant is good for non Japanese people. But you are Japanese, you know the shabu shabu, you have eaten real shabu shabu, or you like to eat real shabu shabu, this is NOT real Japanese shabu shabu place to go. I'm sorry...  But it's True.. I really recommend that this restaurant owner should go to Japan and must eat shabu shabu so he/she knows what the real shabu shabu taste like.  The waitress was nice so I gave 2 stars.  I'm stick with Shabu Shabu restaurant I go regularly. I also recommend that owner take down "Japanese" from name because this is not...

Xo-uFOta5oH9jj-tBCvotw.text: We ate here twice and the food is decent but nothing spectacular.  Pricing is comparable to similar hot pot places but there is a $6 sharing cost.  Our first visit was pleasant and enjoyable and our server was attentitve and organized.  But the second visit, on the following day, was a big downer.  If the days were switched, there would not be a repeat visit.   We sat down in the midst of uncleared dishes and left-over food all around us and it remains that way throughout our dining.  Very unsightly and dampens our appetite for sure and I counted no less than three workers all looking at the dirty dishes.  Where is the manager to pitch in ?  We have to remind our server for everything from sauces to utensils while we watched a boiling pot.  The rice on both days were cold and hard.  When the rice has this big clumps, it can only mean one thing - it has seen its days!   This place looks promising at first but we don't plan to be back for awhile.

5IWZdgvK2nAJktPm-TeH4g.text: My brother had told me about this place and I would see pictures of friends eating at Yojie in Socal. When my brother and I were finally in Vegas at the same time, he insisted I just HAD to go try it out.  Fan of Jokoy? EVEN BETTER! I believe he is one of the owners or partners of Yojie for this location, so if you support him, YOU BETTER DINE HERE!  On the menu, they have a box around the common/popular items, which are the yojie's cut for the plate and sukiyaki for the broth. As a first timer, that is exactly what I ordered in their large size.  All plates come with a bowl of vegetables (lettuce, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, etc.), noodles (which I believe were udon), and your choice of brown or white rice.  If you have a big appetite, I would recommend getting the samurai (large) or the sumo (x-large) because the meat slices are thin, which also makes it easier and faster to cook in your bowl/pot.   The sukiyaki broth is sweet and oh so wonderful. It comes with a fresh PASTEURIZED egg, which you use as a dip for your meat. So before you judge people dipping their meats into what looks like a raw egg, just remember it is pasteurized and tastes amazing!!! I almost don't even want to describe the whole thing and give it away because I feel like people should just come here and try it for themselves lol.  Service is excellent!! I wish I could remember the name of the manager or owner/the super cool zen dude who runs the place, but he's full of good vibes and is extra generous. He interacts with all customers and helps out his employees.  I can't wait to come back here again!

xymNQo_ONP7A-SzpOK3R6g.text: My friend Anton from Yojie LV has been telling me to come by his restaurant forever. After finally going I must say, WOW! Flavor explosion  there were 4 of us we ordered the Kobe Beef and the prime rib, we were able to mix our dipping sauces which was perfect. They brought out a raw egg for dipping after cooking our meats and I must say  it was amazing , the buttery flavor of dipping in the egg was phenomenal. I was almost bummed when I didn't see anyone drinking until I looked to the right and saw someone drinking a frosty cold one! We also had some flavored Saki ! Desert was awesome gourmet doughnuts  , fresh bananas & strawberries   to dip in a gourmet green tea chocolate  dipping sauce.  The whole feng shui and vibe of this place is dope I give it both thumbs up   I would have taken pictures but the food was so good I forgot.

xs72KggyK0MavaQ53lDXJg.text: This place is AMAZING. A must-try when you come to Vegas. Soooo yummy, and incredibly friendly staff. 10/5 stars, easy. I loved the Kobe beef. And they have Mochi!

A8fBTMva5XlNx8_zNfH8AQ.text: This is not exactly like a traditional Shabu Shabu restaurant. You order a personal pot of broth and get your own meat and veggies. I've only ever had this served family style before. That being said, you can still share meat and veggies but everyone gets their own broth. Speaking of the broth, they're all delicious. My wife had the spicy miso and I had the sukiyaki. The miso was pretty spicy, but not ever powering. The sukiyaki was something brand new to me. It's loaded with flavor, very sweet, but tempered well by the raw egg you dip all your meat and veggies in after cooking in the broth. I will definitely be going here again. The service was fast and friendly and very informative.

HxXQRMhQAKL-sLe7bYhTVg.text: This was my first time going to Yojie. I hear there are locations in California as well but I have never tried them. Make sure you take a jacket! It is seriously chilly in there. Since it was my first time, they put a little block in front of us that said "first timers" or something like that. The girl that helped us was super adorable with huge eyes. She was so sweet in explaining everything and how it worked. I tried the cherry blossom team because I read on Yelp that it was super duper scrumptious - it was good indeedy! It comes in this really cool container and you put it on top of your cup and press down - and it comes squirting out like pee haha I got the shabu shabu style with the most popular yojie cut of meat. At first when I had gotten it, I didn't think it was that much food and thought that I would have to order more. I was wrong! It was so filling that I didn't have any room for dessert. The boyfriend and my other friend got the kobe style meat cut with tonkatsu broth. I highly recommend the tonkatsu broth. It was so yummy that I kept stealing his broth. My shabu shabu broth was too plain for me. In the end though, she adds some sauce to the bowl and adds the water from your dish and makes udon noodles. It was really good.   The only thing is that they don't have a liquor license yet so there is no alcohol! I didn't dock off a star for this because it isn't their fault. I definitely plan on coming here more often since its close to the crib!!!

XtjZ98L1WnTeYq4panF5vQ.text: We love their food but a suggestion is to not leave a space between every group in order to maximize seating. We were turned away (hour wait) even though there were enough empty seats

-8OE5QFQGHquoi7-3mxjNw.text: wasn't too excited to try this place but was pleased with my experience. My dad and grandma were first timers shabu shabu and the staff kindly explained the menu along with a demo once the food arrived.   SHABU SHABU is japanese hot pot where thinly sliced proteins are dipped into a boiling pot of broth.  Their choices of broth included spicy miso, sukiyaki, tonkatsu or traditional shabu shabu.  The dipping sauces were on point: goma( sesame base), ponzu ( citrus soy), and swisher ( like teriyaki), each mixed with green onions, chili powder, and daikon.  Their brown rice is good and also refillable, along with the hot pot of broth.   I would definitely come back and maybe try their sukiyaki broth which is served with a raw egg on the side to dip the meat in.

cMymw0kMWAkaXDBmYLug0g.text: Good shabu shabu restaurant as far as this side of of the valley is concerned. You get different choices of meats/fish as well as broths with sauce selections that you can cook with. Another plus for being open during lunch with lower prices. Green tea chocolate fondue desert was great too.  Service and decor are nice. Although, I went during lunch when it was slow and they didn't get their liquor license yet, but hopefully it picks up.

yMjFLFy762hayj75sTaruA.text: My first time eating here was great. The restaurant is clean; the atmosphere, classy; and the food, delicious.   The layout of the restaurant makes for easy and quick service, as customers are basically seated around the servers. There are TVs placed around the tables in case your date is boring, and your phone is running out of battery. (Just kidding, but when I was there, they were playing this hilarious Japanese show about obstacle courses. My friend and I were thoroughly entertained.)  The prices for the menu items are justified, considering the market prices of the different types of meat. I ordered the yojie's cut with sukiyaki broth and brown rice for dinner. My server was attentive enough to make sure I was ok with the egg being uncooked, which I appreciate a great deal.   The stoves are controlled by the servers, and the water takes some time to heat up, but once it's hot, the meat cooks extremely quickly. Each table top has a bottle of water that is used both for drink refills and cooking water refills. Water and rice refills are free. I honestly love how self-paced this restaurant is, while also keeping servers close to the customers at all times. The restaurant also has cute "first-timer" signs to put in front of customers, so servers will come to explain various aspects of the shabu-shabu eating experience to them.  This place has an eye for the small details. I will definitely come back.

UNwcfiNpYqlwiLM4E4R4Ow.text: My experience here was overall great. I typically go when there isn't a lot of people. They are quick with their service which is great if your are hungry. I went with the large portion of yojie cut meat called samurai. Lots of food barely finished it. However, the next time I went I got the medium portion of yojie cut meat called geisha, still filled me up. So portion sizes are great and you get  the complimentary veggies, udon noodles and rice (brown or white) with your meal.   I always get the Sukiyaki broth which comes with a pasteurized egg. Haven't tried the others, but maybe I will next time.   Glad this shabu shabu place is near me on the west side of town. It beats going into the town.

pj4Q4B3oUwDc-HrjCCYoRw.text: Everything, AWESOME. I'll start with the service. Every single person was beyond welcoming and made me feel like I was already a regular (which I will be now!) Jo was there and made it a point to really interact with everyone in the restaurant even through the rush of people. Anton was so great too! He recommended the fondue dessert with the ube ice cream and that was just out of this world. That guy is a genius of tastebuds.  The food. Oh my god the food. I'm a huge pork belly fan and actually reviewed Flemings steakhouse for their pork belly appetizer just last night. That was okay but the pork belly here was off the charts. So tender and tasty. Zb9YCDlcwwcH6qGbj99Nhw.text: 5 stars for delicious shabu shabu, friendly service, and reasonable prices (~$23 per person for the sumo portion). We found this place through word of mouth and celebrated my dad's birthday here. Since then, our family has returned 3-4 more times and service has been consistently good.   Of the hot pot/shabu shabu places I've tried in Las Vegas, Yojie has the highest quality slices of beef. Order the beef (sumo portion), ponzu and peanut dipping sauces (ask for them to mix the garlic in), and the spicy miso broth. Everyone gets their own shabu pot to cook their veggies and meat in.   Pro tip: dip a slice of beef in the boiling water for only a few seconds until it changes color then dip it in the sauces. Do not dump the entire plate of meat in. The beef should only take a few seconds to cook to maintain its tender and juicy consistency-- any longer and it becomes tough.

6kdaZ3dyJcbYA9E2Rcpjsg.text: Disappointed especially bc of good reviews. Took parents here on a weeknight. We were only ones there soon after opening. Bad sign. Beef didn't taste fresh. wb574jLWQYHmvJTeo70lWg.text: Really big portion sizes and well worth the price the food was amazing. It's a clean and neat place. The service was great, they kept checking up on us and making sure we were okay. Would highly recommend. The price is high, about $30 per person including dessert split between people but the portion size is huge enough to where I took the noodles home to have for breakfast the next day. The only thing I would change is the amount of vegetables. There was only a few cabbage slices, a broccoli, two carrots, a slice of onion and a half of a shiitake mushroom which was kind of sad. It would be nice to have a extra side of vegetables but I think (not sure) that they change extra for more vegetables.

6kpm5NsGAucwfpGM9qvo8g.text: This is a hot pot slash fondue type restaurant in Summerlin area. I had a really good dinner tonight with a friend. We were welcomed by the chef and seated immediately. My friend has been here a handful of times and the chef remembered him which I thought was cool.  The restaurant was modern, clean, and had fun music with Japanese TV game shows playing. The entire restaurant was bar seating. They had high seating and lower seating that surrounded the staff. Since I'm Asian I already know the deal. You pick a meat, a broth, and extras. The meats come in different sizes based on ounces. If you let the staff know it is your first time then they'll explain the intended way to eat and show you.  I picked their house special cut of meat in the largest "sumo" size (10 ounces) with the suggest broth of sukiyaki. It was beef. They had four broths to choose from and about 8 - 10 meats.   Aside from the rice and veggies that came with the order of meat, I ordered a side of udon noodles. It already came with udon noodles so I had a lot of noodles.   The meat was served with a pasteurized egg which was meant to dip the meat into AFTER cooking it in the meat. The egg did add a creamy taste to the sweet sukiyaki broth. A second egg for $1.50 is recommended if you get a larger portion of meat.  You get a bottle of alkalized water, tongs, and a ladle to help eat. The alkalized water is supposed to re-hydrate the constantly boiling pot of broth in front of you without diluting the flavor.  At first glance it didn't seem like a lot of food, but it was a really good, filling, almost "light" dinner. I ended up taking a container full of food home because of the extra udon I ordered. The sukiyaki broth was flavorful but a bit one-note aka boring. It was mostly sweet and nothing more. With the savory beef and creamy egg it was delicious.  I had one of their fondue for dessert that was delicious. I got the milk chocolate fondue with fruit and pastries. It came with bananas, strawberries, rice crispy treats, cake, and marshmallows. It was the perfect size for two and only $7.99.  They had great hot tea also.  Over all I thought dinner was memorable. I've done hot pot at home, but it was fun in a restaurant. The food quality was good. The meat was fresh as were the vegetables. I thought the staff was great. One of our severs boxed my udon for me. I felt really taken care of. The chef knew exactly how to talk to the diners to make them feel welcome and comfortable.   We spent just under $80 for the two of us. That was for two full sized meat entrees, two hot teas, an extra pasteurized egg, an extra order of meat, and dessert. I thought it was a a good price for the unique dining experience, food quality, and the service. Keep in mind they do have cheaper cuts of meat if it sounds expensive. I imagine the location adds to the cost.  I'll definitely be back for a treat like a date, a special occasion, or a celebration but not on a regular basis. It was good, but not great. I'll try one of their other broths next time also as the sukiyaki was just okay.  My advice to management is to put the music down. Dinner was so awkward because I kept having to repeat myself and ask my friend to repeat themselves. It made me not want to talk.

hxsmvSFghwT9ym_T-eg2Rg.text: Oh man. Been wanting to try this place since listening to Jo Joy's Koy Pond, totally worth the wait to get here. Got here on a Monday night and it wasnt crowded at all. Got seated on the high top bar and was immediately taken care of. Service here was on point, drinks and order taken very promptly and our food came out quicker than we could get situated. We both had the sukiyaki dinner, broth was perfect, slightly sweet, slightly salty. I had the veggie platter and it had so much variety.... broccoli, glass noodles, onions, shiitake mushrooms, carrots, Napa cabbage, udon noodles and tofu. Didn't need any meat with that! Meal also comes with a raw egg (or dipping sauce of your choice, i got the swishing sauce), unlimited sauce and rice. We left there so stuffed i was a little bummed bc i wanted to try their dessert fondue so badly! (matcha green tea, dark or white dipping chocolate with fruits). This restaurant is super clean (walked in and can't eventually tell its a cook your own kinda place, can't smell it at all), nice counter tops, awesome vibe, nice artwork, hooks under the table for ladies purse, and USB CHARGING PLUGS!!!! I mean what other restaurants have a charging plug at your table?!?!  You can tell a lot of thought went into this restaurant and it really shows, everything from the menu to the little things like the check/bill holder. Would definately come back here again!

SqNI4pdOModrWKlqzusE-g.text: While the food and service were pretty good, my biggest issue was with the bar/counter setup.  All the great shabu shabu meals I've ever had consist of a group of 4+ sitting around one big pot while chatting, swishing, and drinking away.  Here?  If I want to kanpai it up (they say liquor is coming soon) with the fourth person in the party, I have to get up out of my seat, walk 3 chairs down to clink glasses and shoot.  Then stand awkwardly making small talk for 20 seconds before walking back.  That's pretty lame.    It may just be a cultural thing.  Three American dudes probably don't want to share a pot, thus this singular experience.  It's easy to see the powers that be put a lot of time and effort into making Yojie look and run as well as it does, but I'd rather order matzo ball soup and a pastrami sandwich in this setting.  Also:  - The atypical tonkotsu broth goes best with pork or maaaybe chicken.  Beef doesn't work.   - Cherry blossom tea was terrific. - Trust me and at least get the samurai size.  My wife crushed this serving and was ready for more.   - Since shabu shabu is generally a winter meal, they definitely make the room cold enough to feel that way.  Bring a jacket.    They have plans to open up more locations in Vegas, so count on me as a regular at one of the others that are group friendly.

EQ93_9H1q2b4V1cr0Bp4_w.text: A small but cozy place, modern design. We went for Yakisoba broth/ samurai Kobe beef and Tonkotsu/ salmon . Both of the broths were good, carried rich and deep flavor. TEN1uhNfIk5mriEfWDCNcA.text: My cousin was in town and mentioned Jo Koys restaurant so clearly I got curious. Aside from being my favorite comedians place, they really did earn a 5 star.   Its a traditional shabu restaurant with all the seating being in a U shape so everyone is facing inward. So there really isn't a lot of seats but we arrived at just the right time because as soon as we were seated a line started to form and their wait began. When you walk in they all greet you with something, not sure what it was that they said but they did it for every customer so it was really cool to see all the attention each person got from the start.   Our server was incredibly friendly, she explained the way the menu works and helped with some suggestions. I got the spicy broth with a combination of the beef and chicken. I loved the broth! I got to say I drank it all after I ate all the meat. My son and I shared he wanted more, lol. The food is brought out quick and off we go to eating deliciousness!! The food overall was one of the best shabu I've had. They let you pick 2 sauces, I had the ponzu and another sweet one (forgot the name). The ponzu was my sons favorite while I enjoyed the sweet one a bit more.   To end our evening we tried the green tea chocolate fondue with strawberries and bananas. Omg! Get it! You must!

opITOH6qzqmHn_U-58jHlg.text: This place never fails to satisfy my hunger. The portions are good, and I love the environment. For the people that don't know what this place is, it's basically this: you're given a soup of your choice and a meat of your choice(they also have salmon which I rly like), brown or white rice, and vegetables and noodles if you want them. Then you cook the meat/salmon (and the vegetables if you want) in the soup that's boiling over a heating thing. My favorite soup is the sukiyaki with either the Kobe beef or salmon. After you finish the meat, you can cook the udon noodles in the soup, which is one of my favorite parts. I would also recommend their deserts: chocolate of your choice fondue with a platter of your choice. They have fruits, cakes, Rice Krispies, marshmallows, and more. Hope this helps!

_zLalKxJcFiRVR3VU6RhDQ.text: I REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY wished the service here could be better! Because the food is absolutely delicious.   But coming here every time is always an internal debate for me because it takes soooo long to get seated, to get your order taken, to receive food and eventually to receive a check and pay. It seems like they only staff one service during peak hours and doesn't adequately train their staff the importance of sense of urgency, which in turn turning the service into a vicious cycle of eternal waiting.  Last time when my friend and I went there, it took them one hour-60 minutes!! To bring out the dessert we ordered. It was a fruit fondue- about four strawberries, half a banana and 5-6 pieces of cubes of pre-made cake. It escaped us HOW could cutting of such minimal food take an entire hour?! And we asked for the progress 3 times during that hour and every time we told the server that we might just cancel the dessert, she assured us that it would come out within 2 minutes. The promise was never kept.   All in all, good food. But too frustrating to dine in, unless you have at least 2 hours to spare for sitting in a restaurant, searching for your waiter.

p4tFJEMbvaRe0Hp8rDit8A.text: Finally got a chance to stop for some shabu shabu! Thanks husband!  super excited that the kids enjoyed it too! We will be back for sure

MSNlJ68XfGC8S3hmWv-YGA.text: #2 review for Yelp 100 Challenge   Dip, swirl, and swallow.  Double dip if you dare. It's all good. It's shabu shabu! Don't forget to masticate and savor each flavor your palate tastes.  I made sure we were going to dine here during our Vegas trip for Thanksgiving 2015.  I had to see JoKoys new spot.  Gotta support the Kuyas out there!  Dana greeted us with a smile and what started out as a miscommunication regarding reservations worked out at the end.  So. It's a solid 4 1/2  stars.    The place was designed as a typical shabu spot I've been to. Rectangular layout of seatings, counter style.  This way the servers can efficiently maneuver themselves around all the customers.   It's modern and sleek design gives it a great ambiance to dine for small and large groups.  One side is the low bar section  and opposite side is the high bar.  I like the low bar.  Makes me feel safer since I'm short.  Hahaha  I started with their Organic green tea with diffuser.  Cute little gadget which I am not accustomed to.  But I figured it out.  Loved the warmth of the hot tea for the 40 degree temp in sin city.  Dana was great at explaining how their menu works even though it wasn't our first time having shabu shabu.  I like to see that at new establishments.  So, thank you Dana.  You did great sweetie!  We ordered- Kurobuta pork in sukiyaki.  Fresh. Tasty. Loved it.  Pork belly in tonkatsu. Duuuuude... oink heaven!  Prime rib in sukiyaki was my fav.   Absolutely great quality of meats there Josep!  Loved the service.  Parking was a breeze at a huge shopping plaza.  Definitely a must do when I'm in Vegas again!  Can't wait to return!

NSd7-ZavjiGKDlFJ1UTCuA.text: *Warning: Long Review*  Let me start by saying that both my boyfriend and i REALLY enjoyed our experience at Yojie!   Neither one of us had ever been to a Japanese fondue spot before, but I insisted on this place for his birthday a couple of weeks ago. I was curious to try it, and, i must admit, we both like Jo Koy, so the fact that he is  the owner helped persuade him.    It was a Wednesday evening, so we weren't surprised it was a slow night for them. We had the awesome ambience and 90's r&b music all to ourselves. Perfect for our date... When we got there, we were immediately greeted by our server, Michael. When we told him it was my bf's birthday, he brought out a cute little wooden block that says "Happy Birthday" on it...  We explained it was our first time there, so Michael was VERY accommodating and explained how Japanese fondue works.  He even let us record him for social media purposes! He's very sweet, and helpful and a total cutie pie. I also appreciated that he and his other coworkers were very attentive and joked with us a lot along the way. I appreciate good customer service, and they provided it.   The food is excellent. We went with a combination platter that Michael recommended with the beef and pork and paired it with the egg sauce, Shabu shabu.  The combination platter was big enough to feed both of us and it was only $24.99 ! I don't know how they stay in business, maybe with people that eat more than us.   What ABSOLUTELY made our night, though, was the fact that Jo Koy and his wife came in for a late night dinner! My boyfriend couldn't stop cheering the entire time.  seriously, if you don't know who this guy is, you should! That way, if he happens to walk in on your visit there, you can fangirl like we did and ask him for selfies and snapchat videos! Which he will gladly comply to btw, he's cool like that. He even treated us to a complimentary dessert for the occasion. It was a green tea- white chocolate fondue with delicious fruit, brownies, marshmallows, etc. I was in love!    Hope your experience is as awesome as ours was. Say Marcela sent you! It won't mean anything to them, but it'll make me feel special :P

PjpA0n5X-5ufp3cN5Q47rA.text: I came here with a friend for lunch. I got the tonkatsu broth and my friend got the miso broth. We both enjoyed our broths. The meat quality was great. I personally love pork with my hotpot and their pork was tasty and juicy. The only thing that had me rate 4/5 was the dipping sauces and the broth. Dipping sauces were limited and I have definitely had better broth. I am a big broth person.

sd1g4LzaK882MZRmonPlFA.text: I ordered the combo plate today which included rice (white or brown), a bowl of veggies, two sauces of your choice (ponzu, goma or swisher sauce), and your choice of salmon, chicken, pork or pork belly paired with their Yojie cut Angus Beef. Perfect choice because I was starving! I couldn't decide which dip I wanted though so I splurged a little and  ordered half of the sukiyaki and half tonkatsu. To be honest, the tonkatsu was just okay. You can definitely taste the broth but it wasn't all that flavorful in my opinion. The sukiyaki on the other hand was sweet and tasty. If the sweetness is a little too much for you, they advice you to add a little more water just to dilute it. This will be my go to when I come back!   This place is not really group friendly. I understand the concept of it being a bar because of the individual cooker but in cases where there's a large group like I was with today, you're only able to converse with those sitting next to you. Also, it kinda keeps you from sharing food with everyone in your group which could be a good or bad thing.   Servers are helpful especially when you're a first timer.   I'm still hoping to see and take a picture with owner,  Jo Koy. Hasn't happened yet but maybe if I come more often. I'm bound to run into him, right? Haha

A1Ig1GcRb6y2oj0VCRW9jw.text: My friend and I came in around 8:45 PM on a Thursday night. It wasn't packed at all but there was a good amount of people there. As you come in, there's a little stand where you sign in. We were seated right away.   We were handed our menus & our server gave us a few mins to figure out what we wanted. Apparently they're coming out with a new menu & the pork belly won't be included, at least that's what we were told. I ordered the samurai korobuta(sp?) meat and spicy miso base with brown rice & the sweet & savory sauce. So I've never had korobuta meat & I must say... it's delicious! When the meat came out, it honestly didn't look like much. I thought I'd be able to finish it without a problem but I ended up giving away like a fourth of my meat to my friend. The spicy miso went well with the meat but I believe the tonkatsu is a better pairing? I'm not sure. But basically, you're able to cook the meat in the soup for 10-15 seconds then you may devour.   Our server was very nice & came back frequently to check on us to see if we were doing okay. Also, if you're running out of base, all you gotta do is ask!

h9KYy_gOy_kwgATNsZYtMA.text: What a nice and relaxing experience. The environment was modern and has a unique touch. It's only bar seating. Everyone was nice and was super eager to explain the hotpot concept. As small as the whole place is, it was still definitely spacious when eating. Doesn't feel crowded at all. The menu is very easy to read and the presentation of the food is clean and simple. 3 different broths to choose from. We did the spicy miso and tonkotsu which we're both very flavorful. Bowl of veggies was a good variety. U can choose from brown or white rice. They also serve you different condiments and extra toppings to make the meat super flavorful. The swisher and goma sauces are bomb. The yellowish one is the sweet and savory option and it was our favorite. We chose the yojie cut for our meat and it was fresh. Only bad thing I could say about our experience was we ordered too much. There's 3 sizes and we got the large for each of us instead of the regular. Large came with 15 prices and the regular comes with 10-12. So I guess depends how hungry you are. Pricing isn't bad either. Oh and only downside is I wish they gave more noodles! I loved the udon noodles. Iced green tea is bomb, not sweet. Oh and must I say they play THE jams while you are eating. All the slow jams and 90s music you know, so it makes eating much more fun! Haha

DpAkhfMnzl0wwmzKbfd6dw.text: Awesome restaurant! Me and my girlfriend have been to the AYCE shabu grill here in town before and thought that was good, but man is this place levels above.   Service- As soon as you enter they greet you, servers are very informative on the menu and they teach you how to cook/eat the food if you have never been before. The servers always stay on top of your needs and they always come to check back frequently. (My water was always filled which I always think that's a good way to measure service. Because they kept coming back to make sure we were okay.)  Food- My girlfriend got the Yojie meat plate and I got the Prime rib cuts, absolutely fantastic. The meats were of such high quality you could tell just by looking at it. The sauces were otherworldly good. And the rice were free refills! That's always a plus for me. They had two choices white or brown rice, which I thought was a nice touch. And at the end of the meal if you have left over vegetables they make an awesome soup to help put you over the top.  Restaurant- Kindve small, they sit you next to other parties, but it is definitely a beautiful restaurant. They have small personal hot plates for every seat, so you don't have to share with others in your party. And dead phones are never a worry here! (I always deal with that) They have wall plugs so you can charge your phone under every seat which I thought was awesome.  Overall an amazing experience and can't wait to go back!

OlPgLzI2yKhV7mBmpwmkow.text: Friendly staff & delicious food! No reservations, so come early! Sukiyaki w/ yojie beef highly recommended :D

jTem3Bj2-D4C82fbOYCS2w.text: Had absolutley nothing bad to say about this hip shabu shabu joint off the strip. The venue itself is a super chic and unique setup with individual cooktops for each person. The little details in the decor were very cute and modern. Got to try all the soups since I was with a group but get the sukiyaki and egg dip .. to die for! Good job Jo Koy.

uwLrigPXttmZm0ASkgKhCw.text: Overrated japanese fondue place in summerlin...we've been to better shabu-shabu places in town like thousand much better...not worth it! Thumbs down...

lKIAjB8XbWbCWWq4bzzkqw.text: Finally, a reliable shabu place on the Westside! This place already has the reputation of having a wait, so my husband and I decided to check it out on July 4, hoping there weren't too many folks leaving their backyards. We went around 5pm and had zero wait. There was actually a large party of 12 getting ready to set-up on the low-tops. As Philip T. mentioned, it is a bit awkward to have a large group here, but the staff does do their best to accommodate. Service here as super attentive and my delicious iced green tea was always replenished. I thought they did have high quality meats - I opted for the Yojie's cut (geisha size) since it seemed like the best bang for your buck. I got the Spicy Miso dip for $2 extra. Paying extra for a broth/dip is not something I'm used to so that does add to the $$$ you are shelling out. They also do have unlimited rice, but not unlimited veggies like other places. The extra money you end up paying I don't mind so much since this place is convenient. I did think it was interesting that as the owner greeted us, he kept on referring to having a nice "lunch". We ate early evening, around 5pm, so I was curious if that meant we'd get charge lunch pricing. We ended up getting charge dinner, which I was fine with, but would probably try to go for weekend lunches from now on. Although my husband and I were pretty stuffed, the server suggested the green tea and white chocolate fondue for dessert, which I'm really glad we got. Not too sweet and a perfect sharing portion for two (maybe 3) people.

They explain the menu to you and then show you how everything works. The food is DELICIOUS. We ordered all the house specialties and everything was worth it! I can't wait to come back again!

The bar stools for seating are low and high for your preference.  It's not a big restaurant.  There was no alcoholic beverages yet at the time we went.  October 29.
