6hJdhN2CEy91rYcnrw0J0Q.text: Food was okay, but my wife and I came to try a saketini. We were told they didn't have a liquor license, but the people next to us had two bottles of sake brought to them while we were there. No one explained the situation to us, so I'm left to assume that some customers are treated differently here.   Disappointed in the customer service.

x7nInPUtH7R8hFV8imeRiw.text: This place is really good! They have a hot pot for each person and the service is really good too. The only problem was that I was seated 10 minutes after I arrived even though there were a lot of empty seats. Other than that, their sukiyaki is really good! Will definitely come back

4YhRvDT5PNgxnunl7nwjiw.text: First of all, let me say, "YAY! I'm a fan!,". Even though I hit all 5 stars, I feel like this spot is going to be even MORE amazing in a short time, so you should get yourself over there asap! My husband and I had a great time, as well as enjoy the wonderful food.   As soon as we walked in, we knew we were in a place that exemplified the example of "shabu shabu subject matter experts" haha. Anton the owner knows his restaurant, his food, and his team. From the beautiful art and mirrors on the artfully tiled walls, to the ambiance of immersive, enjoyable music and entertaining television, we knew were came to the right place. We had many places like this to visit back home in Orange County, but when we saw this in Las Vegas (where we live now), our eyes opened and mouths dropped LOL! Yay! Shabu Shabu!!  Denise was the first to say hello to us and accommodated us immediately as soon as we walked in. She was very approachable and went over all of the menu details with us. My husband needed a Shabu Shabu protocol refresher since it had been a while since he had said cuisine, and Denise was great at presenting us with the manner in which the food was to be served to us.   As Denise prepped the broth, Carl came to us and offered drinks. He eagerly shared how excited they are to start serving libations soon, and kindly apologized for not having their upcoming saketinis just yet. No apology needed. We're coming back when you do! :) Cheers!  Anton then came and said hello, and introduced himself as the owner. His enthusiasm and pride in his work definitely showed through as he spoke with each of the patrons eating there. I am so excited for this team and i hope this location succeeds!   We were also served by Anna and Mica...basically everyone made their rounds to all of the customers to make sure everyone was ok, so I have to say that they did a great job in keeping all of the food fresh, tea and water filled, and guests happy.   Aside from speaking to the servers and owner, my husband didn't say much of a word to me...not because he was unhappy, but because his mouth was always so full! What a piggie. We both left very happy and satisfied after a final treat to some Mochi. The green tea was our fave!   We'll be back. Sorry we didn't get to meet the chefs back there. You deserve a big thank you as well. Your rice is on point and perfect! We'll be back! Best of success and luck to Yojie's!

jqAal0CwNkRAxoZm1OIo2w.text: Definitely not your ordinary shabu-shabu, but completely worth what you pay for!  Immediately walking in through their front doors, I feel so welcomed with their greetings and the sweet smell of sukiyaki soup. Mmmmmm. Ana seems to often be our server, and it's awesome to be remembered! The service is great, never fail to refill our bowls and alkaline water glasses!    But the food......it is simply to die for (well, maybe to come back for seconds)!! The beef is so tender and even with just the "geisha" size I'm full to my toes! The quality is terrific, as well as the cleanliness (despite even the inevitable spills on the counter). Definitely will be back again and again.

5Cz9gIZwiX-UbE_48z0rLQ.text: Man have I been waiting for this. I moved from California over a year ago and have yet to find a good place to eat Shabu. Me and my girlfriend ended up buying a shabu pot to eat it at home because the restaurants just couldn't cut it. You can imagine how excited we were when we found out that Yojie ( which has a few locations in California ) had come to town.  I'm so happy they brought their quality and service to Vegas. They have very high quality meats, in different grades all the way up to wagyu. Some people complain about the price and portions because they are used to all you can eat shabus in the area or shabus that give you a lot of low quality meat. Yojie has prices comparable to any other good shabu places in California and I would happily pay more for the quality and experience they offer. They even offer sushi grade salmon that you can just dip in sauce and eat raw if you chose to.  And their service. The definition of top notch. Everyone is attentive and friendly and make sure everything is provided before you ask, or promptly when you do. The service alone is worth 5 stars.  While they have a large selection of meats and sauce options, NO MATTER what you do get the green tea fondue for dessert. It is heaven on a tiny fork. We got the fruit and pastries so I highly recommend that. We were so that full we couldn't walk but we still stuffed our faces with delicious green tea chocolate dipped sweets. It was AMAZING.  Needless to say, we are fans and will be back many, many times.

photos.caption: Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is sliced pork. It was good but I would stick to the beef and salmon.
Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;m in love.

ZyFX5skMDx0Dq0VFcMsn_A.text: First time at Yojie & we were very impressed. Service was quick & food was delicious! We've only been to 2 other hot pot places & this was definitely our favorite! The servers were kind, informative & assisted us with preparing our meals. (Other places we've gone to expected us to know what we were doing which lead our sauce to completely burn). They were refilling our drinks & checking up on us to make sure everything was ok. We had the pork belly, chicken, & Yojie special. Everything had so much flavor. We also ordered the cherry blossom tea & Arnold Palmer made with green tea. For dessert we had the platter with fruits & an assortment of cakes with green tea chocolate. Amazeballs. We'll definitely be back! It was worth the 30 minute drive across town.

W5xmftUtqTolMklqzwiztw.text: I am sad to have left Vegas just because of this place. In the days prior to my departure, I ate here twice after my last review. Service was on point. Refills were kept. Fantastic. Based on my receipt, marieanne, you are awesome. She remembered the essentials to my order, coke and no vegetables. I heart you, you deserve boba. Vegas or SoCal boba on me. I will definitely be making a trip back here next time i am in Vegas. I still crave the waygu!

6URnAhMk9qNyZ5IgDsRRIg.text: This place is awesome! Let's start with the service, they were all so friendly, patient and quick to serve us. Our waitress Ozzy cared for us very well. The food is great quality. We all ordered different items including desert and none of us were disappointed. It was a new experience to all of us but Our waitress guided us through it. You can't go wrong with anything you order here. My kids are super picky and yet they loved it!

DAjzo96s13pj3oxn8ofwIg.text: This is a Shabu Shabu restaurant where you get to cook your own meal.  Choice of broth: Spicey Miso, Tonkotsu (pork broth) or water.  Order the type and kind of meat which is cut paper thin and get vegetables  and udon and tofu to cook in the broth.  They also give you a choice of dips such as sesame, ponzu or a soy sauce.    This is served with a bowl of rice and you can ask for more and they gladly accommodate you at no additional charge.  It was very good except I wish they would give more udon noodles, tofu and Nappa Cabbage.  We had to order additional noodles and Vegetables as in down home cooking the vegetables is as much the star of the meal as the meat.

Mc_Ygw2dwlgQzc9L_6hMuw.text: If I could, I would give this place a 3 1/2 stars. We ordered the prime rib shabu shabu.   Hospitality and Facility - 5 stars Food Quality - 5 stars Bang for the Buck - 3 stars Flavor - 3 1/2 stars  This is in comparisons to a similar place that's on Sahara and another location (which we prefer) on Spring Mountain.  Pros, the staff was very friendly. The owner was walking around and talking with the crowd. The waitress was attentive and made sure we were enjoying our dining experience. The restaurant was very clean but that is to be expected for being in business for two weeks and is closer than the other place we go to. The decor was modern and they have induction cooktops (really loved this fact, didn't get that hot in the restaurant and little safer if you have kids). Depending on the entree ordered, you can choose up to four different "meat" serving sizes.   Cons, pricier than the other place we go to. Just like other places, seating is limited. Tried making reservations but got an answering machine with generic message.   But at the end of the day the ponzu and goma sauces is what makes the food and we prefer the sauces from the other place we go to.   For the convenience and atmosphere I would come back. For the price and flavor I would rather drive to the one we usually go to on Spring Mountain.

photos.caption: Photo of Yojié Japanese Fondue - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Modern feel in the restaurant.

p9lr-Th8K-YD4VebCB0pyA.text: So I'm originally from Costa Mesa, CA and lived right across from California Shabu Shabu. So my husband and I ate shabu pretty regularly just out of convenience. So after moving to Vegas, we started craving it. I have to say Yojie is just as good if not better than Cal Shabu. It's so good, that when we're craving it, we freakin drive all the way from Henderson to eat here. Ugh! So lazy and we hate the drive but when we get that craving, we have to have it. This place totally reminds us of home. Their meat and veggies are good and the udon afterwards is the best. Love the servers because they're always attentive. They'll fill your sauce up if needed like I always do. If you want good shabu, please come here. We tried that other place with good reviews that's in Henderson but it's not as good as Yojie.  By the way, after eating here, we like to go next door to Jollibee and get their peach mango pie for dessert.

LU2u2hCjgT2l6EKBrUKCVQ.text: Came here on a Saturday night! Surprisingly there was no wait to take a seat! Yay! Our servers name was Vhalery, such a sweet young lady. She explained the entire menu to us, which this food is shabu shabu and sukiyaki. Vhalery recommended kurobuta pork with spicy miso dip! OMG so delicious. While we were waiting for our food to come out, our party engaged in some conversation with some staff. Marjorie and Anna, also sweet servers. Such a friendly staff, clean restaurant and great food!

krxRHMf_-B8g8s-tZilOMA.text: We were nearby and this was highly rated by Yelp so we took the plunge.  The place is decorated very modern and sleek.   We ordered the pork and beef shabu shabu and it did not disappoint.  Food was fresh and delicious.   Service was good but it could have been better.  Definitely would go back.

yWcVNNYZIjn6d-VAfMHfgw.text: Obsessed w/ this place  beautiful place, awesome employees. They'll tell you step by step on how to eat this amazing ass food!

-PUKV3hJE5ttcxMFMAqedQ.text: After hearing great reviews of this restaurant, we finally gave it a shot on a Friday night.  We enjoyed the fresh food; and the female servers were attentive and down-to-earth. I loved the clean and modern decor of the restaurant, which offered cozy seating arrangement. We can't wait to try the dessert chocolate fondue on our next visit. Here comes the constructive criticism:  the ribeye cut in the Geisha size pot was too expensive for 5 oz. of meat. The Yojie cut of beef offered more value for your buck, which was leaner and tasted just as good. My husband said that it was annoying that the restaurant opened for a year, but continues to list liquor on the menu, albeit they have not secured a liquor license yet.

Mtau7lwbOqmAt5tJTuFCIw.text: This place is seriously amazing! My kids and I absolutely love it. My kids who are 9 years old say that it is their most favorite restaurant. They love it not only for the unique dining experience, but also for one of incredible owners Anton and his wonderful staff. Anton, Shannon and Hannah are so awesome!!!!!! It's always such a blast to have dinner there. Everyone there goes out of their way to make sure that every customer is happy. The food is scrumptious, fresh, healthy and can please just about anyone's palate. We love the Shabu Shabu cooking style and it's so awesome that once you're done with your meat or seafood entree you have a delicious flavorful soup to enjoy. My girls say that they want to have every birthday dinner there. Every time they have a playdate or sleepover they beg me to take them there and I am always happy to oblige. We all can't wait for our next meal there!!!!!

xLhKhGKzLX42CBeltv4Vjw.text: Well, can't say enough about how friendly this place is.  Staff, all staff, is awesome.  They open at 1130 - but today it was very cold for Vegas and they opened the door early for us at 1100 so we could get out of the cold.  It's a cook yourself style of eating is case you didn't get it.  The prices are reasonable, the sauces are fantastic (they have ghost pepper !!!) and the green tea fondue is awesome.  If it's your first time try lunch - a bit cheaper and slower so you can learn what it's about.

tS1Csj2BQnePSi9kKq21gg.text: We came in for lunch with the wife and were blown away. This place isnt just a restaurant, it's an experience! The food was amazing and the staff (Ana and Carl) was attentive and super cool. We will gladly come here again!++

jPIvQV0RabmZHkVj8rH5SQ.text: Food is great. I love yojie cut, pork, pork belly. I've tried different soup: spicy miso, sukiyaki, and tonkutsu. Sukiyaki is good, more like sweet side after egg dipping. I like spicy so i go for spicy miso most of the times. Ponzu sauce is perfect with everything. I put more chili oil in there though. I also like swisher sauce so I switched it once a while. Goma sauce is good with veggie but I can live without it. Service is excellent. Servers always smile and friendly. When they are packed, the service is a little slow but it's understandable.  The decoration and atmosphere is nice and clean. (I love purple and white so they win lol)  The price is good compare to the portion. One order of meat fills me. It is just perfect. But my bf is a big guy so he usually orders combo. I ordered combo once, I couldn't finish it, and the leftover wasn't that good. I prefer one order of meat and end with Green tea white chocolate plate. I have food orgasm every time I come here.

-vYr0cxPTmbg2qj_VprQ4A.text: I have had shabu shabu at a few restaurants in Vegas and all of them were okay until I ate at Yojie! They are the ABSOLUTELY BEST shabu shabu restaurant in Las Vegas hands down! Their staff is so welcoming and friendly! I've ate at this restaurant so many times that the whole staff knows me! Their food is that good! I personally know Mendrick Leelin who is the co-founder/CEO of the restaurant and Anton Guerrero who is the franchise owner. Both guys are very sweet and so down to earth! The interior design of the restaurant is phenomenal. It is very contemporary and modern! I love that under the seating that there is a place to hang your purse and an outlet to charge your phone. The food here is VERY clean and healthy! I usually always order the Yojie cut beef in sumo size as picture is shown which is the largest size because I'm always extremely hungry every time I come to the restaurant. Every order comes with a bowl of veggies with noodles in case you want to make udon or ramen if you are really hungry. Plus you get to choose your side of rice if you want white rice or brown rice. Make sure to save room for dessert! My fave as shown is the fresh strawberries with green tea white chocolate fondue! I'm not really a big fan of sweets, BUT this is the best dessert on their menu! This is a MUST have!

PxaeLMkA-V8H2pZ5xoCo_w.text: We been already in similar restaurant like that in Boston, which was great!!! This one is just a food , if you never eat nothing more sweet then carrots, you may think you eat the sweetest things ever. We choose deferent broth, spicy is ok, but second it too sweet and terrible, all sauces is very plain, they taste just like poor of bottle and best brand , not like something made in house and great. Chose of vegetables that coming with main dish just ok , mostly chimes cabbage...over all very disappointment experience it all. Overprice !!! Specially for quality food.

oLCFNVM70f68ceNJrCrvxw.text: I have never had Shabu Shabu, so this was a totally new experience. I didn't know what to expect, so where do I start? First of all, we were greeted as soon as we walked through the door. Once seated, our server explained how the whole process worked. We ordered our food and all I can say is WOW!!! the meat was sooo good, the  veggies fresh and the presentation was A1.  I must say we enjoyed our dinner and have been back several times. My daughter, her boyfriend and 6 other couples enjoyed prom dinner at Yojie's as well...it is definitely on top of our favorite list!

MyBnwZMuHxBCXxR8_GepnQ.text: TOP NOTCH CUSTOMER SERVICE! The food was amazing! What better place to go to when you just want to chill out with your girlfriend at a restaurant with amazing food watching Godzilla on tv than Yojie?! Love this place!

NSpbAGtrEeRLk429q5bamg.text: My wife and I go here every so often. Delicious and super close to our house. Love the decor and set up. However, the restaurant is freezing. Definitely bring a jacket!
